title: Cloud Engineer
description:
**Cloud Engineer**


Join us at Kivra! At Kivra, we are building services that connect over 6 million people with more than 50 000 senders in both the private and public sector. We provide a safe and accessible digital infrastructure that everyone in Sweden can trust and use.


We are now looking for a skilled Cloud Engineer with an enthusiastic mindset to join our Cloud team. This team is a core part of our Platform Engineering domain, which is the heart of Kivra. The domain itself comprises four teams, each with a different focus area, all dedicated to building and supporting the large, scalable platform for all our services. This platform provides distributed systems that handle all our data with great reliability and security.

**What you'll do**


You'll play a key role in Kivras Cloud team, where you will work alongside great colleagues and be a driving force for developing, maintaining and improving the GCP infrastructure, as well as have an advisory role towards the rest of the organization in explaining the architecture and system solutions. You will develop, take ownership and drive implementation of new tools in order to make our cloud infrastructure more efficient as well as maintain and improve our current environment. And always with a focus on the security and stability of our services!


Our technology buzzword bingo; :

* Hybrid cloud based on Google Cloud Platform and on-prem Kubernetes platform
* Containers for all (well, almost all) workloads
* Automation and provisioning using ArgoCD, Terraform and Crossplane
* Google LB, KrakenD
* Prometheus, Sentry, Pagerduty, Grafana Cloud, Cloud logs,Loki
* Erlang and Golang backend services
* PostgreSQL and Redis databases
* Kafka and Cloud Pub/Sub

##### **Required skills**


Who you are and how you fit the team is super important. We thrive on being nice and helpful to each other and to the rest of the company!


But to have fun at Kivra you also need to have strong skills in Google Cloud Platform, Platform Engineering, Linux, Enterprise level IT system management and automation (e.g. Crossplane/Terraform) paired with an equally strong sense of service. You have worked with Cloud Engineering, CI/CD and Devops for some years now and are therefore well versed in working in various types of cloud environments. You like taking technical ownership over the things you build and, to quote ourselves, “always with a focus on the security and stability of our services''.

##### **Desired skills**


Previous experience working with Kubernetes and Terraform is a must. Moreover, a solid understanding of containers and container orchestration would make you an even stronger candidate.


The role also gives you the opportunity to specialize even more in the cloud environment and be our internal spokesperson for its best practices. We are looking for someone with a strong skill set and past experience within our tech stack. We have a very warm and friendly culture and we expect you to take part in that naturally. We thrive on collaboration and teamwork, we expect personal initiatives and love strong opinions based on facts.

**We offer**


Kivra offers a place in a committed team with the opportunity for a high degree of innovation. You will be involved in influencing Kivra's exciting business and product development of a service that is currently used by more than half of Sweden's population. We offer the flexibility that life sometimes requires, but we believe that collaboration and value creation happens best when we sit and work together from our office in central Stockholm. Moreover, please note that this role requires Swedish citizenship, as it involves access to systems and information subject to national security regulations.


We offer competitive remuneration and great benefits. Read more about our core values and benefits here: https://jobs.kivra.dev/!

**How to apply**


Easy peasy, just send in your CV and cover letter as soon as possible. If you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact Sarah Ohlsson, Talent Acquisition Partner at sarah.ohlsson@kivra.com.

title: IT Support Sweden
description:
*Do you want to be the person who makes technology simple, smooth, and stress-free for others? At GlobalConnect, we’re looking for an IT Supporter who shares our vision of making technology accessible and easy for every employee across our company.*
**About The Role**
 As an IT Supporter, you’ll be at the heart of our technical support operations. Some days, you’ll solve problems over the phone before the coffee even cools; other days, you’ll make sure new colleagues have everything they need to get started on their first day. You’ll help ensure our tools and systems work seamlessly so our teams can focus on what they do best.
   

  

 Your work will be varied — from hands-on troubleshooting to preparing new equipment, from guiding colleagues through technical questions to keeping our systems running smoothly. Every interaction is an opportunity to solve a problem, learn something new, and create a positive experience for someone else.
   

  

**Some Of Your Responsibilities Will Include**
* Providing first-line IT support via phone, email, and in person
* Setting up accounts, devices, and software for new employees
* Managing and resolving support tickets in ServiceNow or other ticketing systems
* Maintaining smooth operations in Microsoft 365, Azure Active Directory, and Active Directory environments


 This is a
 **temporary position until May 30th 2027.**
**Why join us?**
 At GlobalConnect, we believe technology should empower people, not frustrate them. Our IT team is friendly, solution-focused, and always ready to share knowledge. You’ll be part of a group that values teamwork and enjoys making everyday work life easier for colleagues across the Nordics.
   

  

 We also believe in giving you the space to learn and grow — whether that’s diving deeper into IT systems, exploring new tools, or finding smarter ways to work.
   

  

**To make an impact in this role, we think you’ll need:**
* An interest in IT and technology, and curiosity to keep learning
* Experience with Microsoft 365, Azure Active Directory, and/or Active Directory
* Experience with ServiceNow or other ticket management tools
* Fluency in Swedish and English, both spoken and written


 We don’t need a personal letter unless there’s something you’d like to explain that isn’t covered in your CV or LinkedIn profile.
   

  

**About Us**
 GlobalConnect is one of the leading connectivity providers in Northern Europe. We’re 2000 passionate and talented individuals who want to make a difference, turning our customers’ visions into reality through connectivity. Our goal is to create the best possible conditions for engaged employees, a place where you can develop and grow, and create unforgettable memories and enjoyable experiences.
   

  

 We have helped develop and digitize societies across the Nordics for more than two decades. Our purpose is what drives us to continue - turning visions into reality by empowering society with connectivity.

title: System Engineer
description:
Are you passionate about designing and integrating complex systems that combine electronics, software, and mechanical components? Do you thrive in dynamic, cross-disciplinary projects and want to make a real impact on next-generation technology? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!
 



  





 We’re looking for someone who has:
 



  




* A
 **Bachelor’s or Master’s degree** 
 in Systems Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Minimum 5 years of experience with
 **SysML/UML modeling tools** 
 such as Cameo Systems Modeler, Enterprise Architect, IBM Rational Rhapsody, or Capella.
* Minimum 5 years of experience with
 **MATLAB/Simulink modeling environments** 
 (System Composer) and/or Python.
* Strong communication skills and the ability to work
 **independently or collaboratively** 
 in project teams.



  





 It’s also a plus if you have experience with:
 



  




* **Requirements management tools** 
 like DOORS Next Generation, JIRA/Confluence, or similar platforms for traceability.



  





 As a Systems Engineer, you will have an opportunity to contribute to diverse and exciting assignments, including:
 



  




* Designing and integrating systems across electrical, electronic, and software domains.
* Modeling system behavior and architecture using SysML/UML.
* Developing simulation models and control algorithms in MATLAB/Simulink or Python.
* Working on prototype and proof-of-concept projects for innovative technology solutions.
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams to develop, verify, and test systems end-to-end.
* Exploring emerging technologies, from battery-electric vehicles and autonomous systems to industrial machinery and aerospace applications.
* Supporting process improvements, automating workflows, and introducing new tools and methodologies.



  





*Ready to be part of our journey? Apply today – we’re just one application away!* 




  





**What we offer you?** 




 Every employee is equally valuable in the success of ALTEN! We believe in growing together by offering opportunities, development and togetherness.
 



 ALTEN operates in several different industries, having a wide variety of assignments, coaching managers and training through ALTEN Academy, which means that it will always be possible to develop at ALTEN. Your wishes will guide your way forward.
 



 As a consultant, you will get the genuine team feeling at your assignment but also a wonderful togetherness at ALTEN. Through our different internal networks, such as Women@ALTEN and ALTEN Sports you will get the opportunity to drive topics and activities that are close to your heart. At ALTEN, we think it's important to have a balance between work and spare time, which is why we offer three extra days off a year. We have a collective agreement and offer benefits like pension, insurances and wellness grants.
 



**About ALTEN** 




  





 ALTEN is one of Europe’s largest technology and IT consulting companies with over 57,000 employees in nearly 30 countries. Our engineers carry out complex and highly technical projects throughout the value chain of the most prestigious companies in all sectors,such as Automotive, Defense, Energy & Environment, Industry, Public services & Government and Life Sciences. In Sweden, we are about 1300 committed employees with 9offices in 9 cities - from Lund in the south to Skellefteå in the north.
 



 For the fifthyear in a row, ALTEN has been named one of Sweden's most attractive employers by Karriärföretagen, an award for employers that offer unique career and development opportunities.
 



 Welcome to read more about us at alten.se

title: IT Project Manager
description:
About Tool Metrica
 



  





 Tool Metrica is a modular ERP and asset management platform that helps businesses track and manage physical assets, fleets, and inventories - from construction tools and warehouse equipment to logistics pallets and animals. Our mission is simple: Track Anything. Anywhere. With Tool Metrica.
 



  





 We are scaling up and looking for an experienced IT Project Manager to help us build, coordinate, and deliver the next generation of our platform — combining IoT, data analytics, and enterprise automation.
 



  





 What You’ll Do
 



  




* Lead full lifecycle delivery of complex software modules — from requirements to release.
* Translate product vision into clear, structured roadmaps and sprint goals.
* Coordinate cross-functional teams (backend, frontend, mobile, data).
* Establish transparent processes and a culture of ownership and collaboration.
* Manage scope, timelines, and deliverables in close collaboration with founders.
* Communicate effectively with stakeholders, aligning technical capabilities with business objectives.
* Support continuous improvement of development processes and delivery performance.



  





**What We’re Looking For** 




  




* 5+ years of experience in IT Project Management.
* Proven success in leading software development projects (preferably SaaS, ERP, or data-driven systems).
* Strong grasp of Agile / Scrum / Kanban frameworks and practical implementation.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
* Experience in managing distributed or cross-functional teams.
* Technical literacy and a pragmatic approach to problem-solving.
* Fluent in English; Swedish is a plus.



  





**Nice to Have** 




  




* Background in asset/fleet management, logistics, or industrial automation.
* Experience integrating telematics or IoT data sources.
* Familiarity with financial reporting, order management, or delivery scheduling systems.



  





**Why Join Tool Metrica** 



* Work directly with a team that values transparency, autonomy, and engineering culture.
* Shape the roadmap of a fast-evolving modular ERP ecosystem.
* Flat structure, minimal bureaucracy
* Flexible hybrid setup - results matter more than hours.



  





**Interested?** 




**Let’s build the future of smart asset management together.** 




**👉 Apply via LinkedIn**

title: Systemtekniker IT-säkerhet (CSIRT)
description:
*Söker du en roll där du får möjlighet att utvecklas och bygga upp något nytt, och samtidigt bidra till en stabil och säker samhällsviktig verksamhet? Då kan tjänsten som Systemtekniker IT-säkerhet vara din nästa utmaning!* 




  





 Just nu pågår spännande förändringar inom IT på LFV och området IT-säkerhet är inget undantag. Enheten för IT-säkerhet arbetar för att säkerställa en robust infrastruktur som uppfyller samhällets krav. Vi ansvarar för IT-säkerhetstjänster och IT-säkerhetsutveckling och stöttar organisationen med vår specialistkompetens. Vi övervakar våra IT-miljöer för att upptäcka händelser som kan påverka säkerheten och bevakar omvärlden för att identifiera nya säkerhetshål och risker.
 



  





 Vi är nu i uppstarten av att bygga upp en viktig och helt ny funktion: vårt eget Computer Security Incident Response Team (CSIRT). Tillsammans lägger vi grunden för en starkare och mer samlad förmåga att upptäcka, hantera och förebygga cyberhot. Vår enhet består idag av fyra anställda och kommer att växa under kommande år.
 



  





 Enheten för IT-säkerhet tillhör avdelningen System och Utveckling (SoU) som bedriver kommunikations-, navigations- och övervakningstjänster. Avdelningen ansvarar för LFVs administrativa informationsteknologi samt utvecklingsverksamhet och system-planering och anskaffning. Totalt är vi ca 170 anställda på SoU.
 



  





**Placeringsort: Stockholm/Arlanda eller Norrköping** 




  





**Din roll** 




 Som Systemtekniker IT-säkerhet kommer du ha en viktig roll i uppbyggnaden och utvecklingen av vårt nya CSIRT dvs att skapa en strukturerad och samordnad förmåga att upptäcka, analysera, hantera och förebygga IT-säkerhetsincidenter.
 



 Hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta med teknik i en större komplex IT-miljö där flera olika system interagerar med varandra. Förutom uppbygganden av CSIRT kommer du också att bidra med analyser av krav på säkerhetsfunktioner och IT-tekniska säkerhetsbrister. Tillsammans med dina kollegor ansvarar du bland annat för:
 


* Analys och utredning av säkerhetshändelser från SOC till intern rapportering
* Sårbarhetsscanning och sårbarhetshantering
* Cyberhotmodellering
* Threat hunting
* IT-forensik
* Threat intelligence



  





 LFV prioriterar kompetensutveckling och erbjuder möjligheter till utbildningar som främjar personlig och professionell utveckling i rollen. Vi samverkar internationellt och vår verksamhet är spridd på flertalet orter, exempelvis Arlanda, Sturup och Norrköping, vilket kan innebära resor i tjänsten.
 



  





**Din profil** 




 För att vara framgångsrik i rollen som systemtekniker behöver du följande kvalifikationer och erfarenheter:
 


* Högskole- eller yrkesutbildning inom IT eller motsvarande kompetens förvärvad på annat sätt
* God och aktuell kunskap om operativsystem (Windows och Linux)
* God och aktuell kunskap om nätverk och brandväggar
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, i såväl tal som skrift



  





 Det är meriterande om du också har:
 


* Erfarenhet av att arbete inom CSIRT eller SOC
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med SIEM, EDR och NDR
* Erfarenhet om logganalys och loggplattformar
* God kunskap inom IT-forensik/nätverksforensik
* Erfarenhet av sårbarhetshantering
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i organisationer med säkerhetskänslig verksamhet eller verksamhet med höga krav på IT-säkerhet



  





 Du har ett starkt intresse för IT-säkerhet och vill gärna utvecklas vidare inom området. Som person har du god samarbetsförmåga och är kommunikativ, samtidigt som du trivs med att arbeta självständigt. Med en stark problemlösningsförmåga levererar du resultat av hög kvalitet. Du är flexibel och öppen för förändring, trivs med att anpassa dig till nya situationer och utmaningar, och har en prestigelös inställning som gör att du gärna samarbetar över gränser och delar kunskap med andra.
 



  





**Vi ser inget hinder om du är i början av din yrkeskarriär, en kortare yrkeserfarenhet kan vägas upp av energi och engagemang.** 
 I denna rekrytering lägger vi stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
 



  





**Anställning** 




 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med eventuell provanställning och med placeringsort i Stockholm eller Norrköping. Innan anställning genomför vi en säkerhetsprövning som bland annat innefattar registerkontroll, säkerhetsintervju och drogtest. Denna tjänst kräver svenskt medborgarskap.
 



  





 LFV har goda anställningsvillkor och ett brett utbud av förmåner som bland annat innefattar goda utbildningsmöjligheter, en privat sjukvårdsförsäkring och goda pensionsvillkor. Vi erbjuder ett utvecklande arbete tillsammans med lösningsorienterade, engagerade och nytänkande kollegor.
 



 Varmt välkommen att söka tjänsten! Sista ansökningsdag är den 9 december.

title: Technical Account Manager, Google Cloud Consulting
description:
**Minimum qualifications:**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
* 5 years of experience in a customer-facing role working with stakeholders, driving customer technical implementations or transformation programs.
* Experience supporting customers in cloud operations (e.g., launch or capacity planning, product release management), technical support, escalation management, or IT consulting.


**Preferred qualifications:**
* MBA or Master’s degree in a Management, Technical, or Engineering field.
* Experience translating business requirements into technological solutions.
* Experience in application or workload migration to public cloud providers.
* Experience collaborating with teams, groups, business units, channel partners, systems integrators, and third-party developers to deliver high-impact solutions.
* Understanding of IT operations, database systems, networking, IT security, application development, service architecture, cloud-native application development, hosted services, storage systems, or content delivery networks.
* Excellent written and verbal communication, presentation, problem-solving, and client management skills.


**About The Job**
 Our Google Cloud Consulting organization within Google Cloud delivers product and implementation expertise to our strategic customers to help them get the most out of their Google Cloud investments.
   

  

 As a Technical Account Manager (TAM), you will draw on our customer-facing skills and technical acumen to help customers successfully adopt Google Cloud products. Your previous experience with cloud infrastructure, program management, enterprise technology implementation, strategy development and customer advocacy will play a critical part in your day to day work driving success at our most critical customers. You will lead the successful adoption of Google Cloud at leading organizations, guiding them through the strategic and technical facets of their Cloud transformation journey.
   

  

 In this role, you will drive customer adoption of Google Cloud services, like Google Compute Engine, Vertex AI, Google Kubernetes Engine, BigQuery, and many more. You will regularly engage with stakeholder groups, including executives of large enterprises and a cross-functional and geographically dispersed team. You will utilize relationship management skills and technical credibility to effectively communicate at all levels of the organization, establishing themselves as a trusted advisor.
   

  

 Travel (domestically and internationally) up to approximately 20% of the time as needed.
   

  

 Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Accelerate customer adoption of Google Cloud by leading the implementation journey. Provide technical guidance and manage timelines, milestones, migration goal and business transformation strategies.
* Advocate for customer needs in order to overcome adoption blockers and drive new feature development. Lead across multiple work streams and teams to maintain customer momentum.
* Develop relationships with stakeholders to understand customer’s business, develop strategic roadmaps, and lead quarterly business reviews and executive sessions to better understand business and technical needs.
* Plan for customer events and launches, partnering with Support, Engineers, and Site Reliability Engineers to ensure customer success, and work with customers and Support to guide issues/escalations to resolution.
* Develop best practices and assets based on learnings from customer engagements to support initiatives to scale through partners and accelerate Google Cloud adoption.


 Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

title: Data Centre Technician - Stockholm
description:
CoreWeave is The Essential Cloud for AI™. Built for pioneers by pioneers, CoreWeave delivers a platform of technology, tools, and teams that enables innovators to build and scale AI with confidence. Trusted by leading AI labs, startups, and global enterprises, CoreWeave combines superior infrastructure performance with deep technical expertise to accelerate breakthroughs and turn compute into capability. Founded in 2017, CoreWeave became a publicly traded company (Nasdaq: CRWV) in March 2025. Learn more at www.coreweave.com.
   

  

 We're proud to be a Living Wage accredited Employer.
   

  

 We are seeking experienced Data Center Technicians to join our team in Stockholm.
   

  

**Location: This is a 100% on-site** 
 position at our Data Center in Stockholm. A relocation allowance is available for national and international candidates.
   

  

**Salary:** 
 490,000 SEK - 760,000 SEK per year. Relocation allowance is available for national and international candidates.
   

  

 The Data Center Technician must work well with others and will help ensure overall availability and reliability to meet or exceed defined service levels of data center operations. This position involves hardware and network diagnostics followed by physical repair and will include participation in an on-call rotation.
   

  

* Maintain data center operations to ensure the availability and reliability of service levels
* Conduct hardware and network diagnostics and repairs
* Root cause analysis of hardware and software failures
* Training of internal teams
* Development of documentation
* Provide technical support to data center teams
* Development of scripts to update server and networking hardware
* Maintain inventory
* Assemble and install equipment
* Perform maintenance of test and tool equipment
* Occasional travel to other data centers as needed


**Requirements**
* 3+ years of data centre experience
* Experience with Data Center buildout, assembling and installing equipment
* Computer hardware experience (troubleshooting, assembling)
* Linux operating system experience
* Ability to work in an environment that operates a shift pattern, with an ability to participate in on-call rotation and provide after-hours support as needed
* Excellent time management, organisational and communication skills
* Must be able to prioritise tasks and react quickly to issues
* Candidates should be able to lift up to 22kg and/or work in elevated locations
* Applicants must have work authorisation that does not require sponsorship from the company now or in the future.


**Nice Haves**
* Computer Networking experience
* Python, Bash or other scripting languages experience
* Experience with Cisco IOS and/or Juniper JunOS
* A degree or equivalent experience in an IT related field


*To fulfil our obligation to protect client data, successful applicants offered employment with CoreWeave will be required to complete a basic criminal record check, conducted in compliance with GDPR. Employment offers are conditional upon receiving satisfactory check results*
**What We Offer**
 In addition to a competitive salary, we offer a variety of benefits to support your needs, including:
   

  

* Family-level Medical Insurance
* Family-level Dental Insurance
* Generous Pension Contribution
* Life Assurance at 4x Salary
* Critical Illness Cover
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Work culture focused on innovative disruption


*Benefits may vary by location.*
**Our Workplace**
 While we prioritize a hybrid work environment, remote work may be considered for candidates located more than 30 miles from an office, based on role requirements for specialized skill sets. New hires will be invited to attend onboarding at one of our hubs within their first month. Teams also gather quarterly to support collaboration
   

  

*CoreWeave is an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and supportive workplace. All qualified applicants and candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or genetic information.*
**CoreWeave does not accept speculative CVs. Any unsolicited CVs received will be treated as the property of CoreWeave and your Terms & Conditions associated with the use of CVs will be considered null and void.**
**Any unsolicited CVs sent by your company to us – that is to say, in any situation where we have not directly engaged your company in writing to supply candidates for a specific vacancy – will be considered by us to be a “free gift”, leaving us liable for no fees whatsoever should we choose to contact the candidate directly and engage the candidate’s services, and will in no way establish any prior claim by your company to representation of that candidate should the candidate’s details also be submitted by any other party.**
**Export Control Compliance**
 This position requires access to export controlled information. To conform to U.S. Government export regulations applicable to that information, applicant must either be (A) a U.S. person, defined as a (i) U.S. citizen or national, (ii) U.S. lawful permanent resident (green card holder), (iii) refugee under 8 U.S.C.
   

  

* 1157, or (iv) asylee under 8 U.S.C.
* 1158, (B) eligible to access the export controlled information without a required export authorization, or (C) eligible and reasonably likely to obtain the required export authorization from the applicable U.S. government agency. CoreWeave may, for legitimate business reasons, decline to pursue any export licensing process.

title: Senior Application Support Consultant
description:
We are in Business for People, empowering people in service organizations with innovative Enterprise and Business software solutions. We’ve innovated and taken a new approach to delivering ERP that works for people. Self-driving, adaptive and intuitive software that is changing the way people work. Our solutions empower people and deliver a better people experience so people can spend time on meaningful high value work they live for.
   

  





 Read more on our website about how we transform work and how people feel about it, so our customers and their people can thrive.
   

  

  

  




**Job Description**

**ERP Support Consultant – Unit4 ERP Core & Finance**




**About the Role**




 Unit4 is looking for an experienced Application ERP Support Consultant to join our Customer Support team. As an Application Support Consultant, you are the first point of contact for our customers on IT and Business Application related questions for our solutions. In this role, you will provide expert guidance and support for
 **Unit4 ERP Core** 
 , with a strong focus on finance modules and technical understanding. You’ll be a key contact for our customers, helping them resolve issues and optimize their use of the system.
 **This role requires on-site presence once a week.**




**Responsibilities**



* Deliver high-quality support for
 **Unit4 ERP Core** 
 , especially within finance and accounting.
* Troubleshoot and analyze both technical and functional issues. This involves investigate, process and document application issue.
* Collaborate with developers, consultants, and product owners to improve system functionality.
* Document solutions and contribute to our internal knowledge base.
* Participate in improvement initiatives and customer dialogues.


**Qualifications**
* Minimum
 **3 years of experience** 
 working with
 **ERP** 
 systems in finance.
* Understanding of
 **Unit4 ERP Core** 
 functionalities is a strong plus.
* Excellent communication skills, fluent in both
 **English and Swedish** 
 (spoken and written).
* Exhibits good analytical and problem-solving abilities.


**Additional Information**

 Join Unit4 and be part of one of the most exciting journeys in the cloud ERP software space. We’re a fast-paced, high-growth, people-centric company, delivering enterprise software for a great people experience, and offering our own people a host of benefits and development opportunities.
   

  





**Grow with us**




 At Unit4, we offer:
   

  




* A culture built on trust - giving you the freedom and autonomy to be successful;
* Balance - with our uncapped time off policy, remote working opportunities, and Global Wellbeing Days when the whole company can switch off and prioritize well-being;
* Talented colleagues, role models and mentors - work, learn and be inspired by some of the best talent in the software industry;
* A commitment to sustainability - with initiatives such as our Act4Good program, a way for everyone at Unit4 to come together and engage in actions that benefit society and the planet;
* A safe and inclusive working environment – supported by our Employee Resource Groups, which are open to all and include Women at Unit4, Pride at Unit4, Mental Health and Access at Unit4, and People of Color at Unit4.



**This role may require security clearance required for customer projects and access to sensitive (customer) data. That means that after you have accepted our offer, we could ask for background checks. Subject to applicable local laws, such security checks may require disclosure of personal information including criminal record declaration, right to work, personal identification and work history. No worries though – we'll handle it according to local privacy laws and keep your info safe. Questions? Feel free to reach out!**

title: Managing Director - Dell Technologies Sweden
description:
Dell Technologies is not just a technology company — we are a transformation partner. We’ve evolved into a global leader in digital infrastructure, cloud solutions, edge computing, and AI innovation. Our mission is to drive human progress through technology, and we do this by empowering organisations to modernise, automate, and innovate.
   

  

 We are now looking for a Managing Director for Sweden to lead our successful organisation based in Solna, Sweden
   

  

 As Managing Director you will oversee the development and enablement of our Dell Technologies business and be our public figurehead in Sweden. The role includes significant leadership across the different businesses, which make up the Dell Technologies family. To ensure that all business units & field organisations feel part of the Swedish team, are well aligned and working together to the common good of all our Dell Technologies customers and partners in country.
   

  

**What You’ll Achieve**
 As a Managing Director, you will develop strategic vision for Dell Technologies Sweden and manage all sales operations for an organisation or business while building and maintaining strong, long-lasting customer relationships at a strategic level.
   

  

**You will:**
* Lead the Swedish Sales Team and Work Council
* Represent Dell Technologies in press, industry associations, and public forums
* Implement Dell’s business strategy with a deep understanding of Sweden’s evolving technology landscape
* Hold full revenue, margin, and OPEX responsibility for the Swedish sales business


**Reporting Structure**
 This role leads a matrixed organisation of approximately 200+ people and reports to the
 **President of Sales EMEA** 
 region.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Build diverse, highly skilled, and professional teams
* Foster a collaborative and customer-focused culture across the Swedish organisation
* Ensure strategic agility to stay competitive in dynamic markets
* Influence the IT agenda at the highest levels, including CxO and government stakeholders
* Deliver outstanding customer experiences and complex business solutions
* Act as a keynote speaker and press spokesperson on AI strategy and Dell’s role in transformation
* Drive strategic account management and pipeline development
* Attract, retain, and develop top-tier sales talent
* Represent Dell Technologies in the Swedish IT community and broader ecosystem
* Lead the sales organisation to meet or exceed performance objectives
* Actively contribute to the North European Senior Management Team


**What We’re Looking For**
 We need a leader who thrives in transformation. Someone who can:
   

  

* Lead with clarity and purpose in a fast-evolving tech landscape
* Drive growth through bold sales strategies and customer-centric execution
* Inspire teams to embrace change, innovate, and deliver exceptional results
* Growth-focused leadership opportunity where AI is central to the strategy


**Requirements**
* Proven track record in managing technology sales or solutions businesses
* Inspirational leadership and results-driven mindset
* Experience managing matrix organisations
* Strong business acumen, change management and adaptability
* Master’s degree or MBA with commercial orientation preferred
* Fluent in Swedish and English


**Who We Are**
 We believe that each of us has the power to make an impact. That’s why we put our team members at the center of everything we do. If you’re looking for an opportunity to grow your career with some of the best minds and most advanced tech in the industry, we’re looking for you.
   

  

 Dell Technologies is a unique family of businesses that helps individuals and organizations transform how they work, live and play. Join us to build a future that works for everyone because Progress Takes All of Us.
   

  

**Application closing date:** 
**31. December 2025**
 Dell Technologies is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. Read the full Equal Employment Opportunity Policy here.
   

  

**Job ID:** 
 R280925Job Function: Outside Sales

title: Business Strategy & Insights Manager
description:
**Elekta. Hope for everyone dealing with cancer.** 
  

  

 In our world, billions of people, millions of cancers diagnosed each year. For everyone, it’s personal. Behind every treatment lies a story, a family, a future.
   

  

 Behind every patient, clinic, and care provider, are real complexities, real needs, and a united purpose. We’re not intimidated, we’re inspired, because every difference – from the smallest tumor change to the greatest clinical challenge is a chance to innovate together and advance care. That’s why we’re here. With you. To set the new standard of care, making a meaningful impact on lives, for a world of difference.
   

  

**Join a team that turns intelligence into impact**
 Are you passionate about transforming data into strategic advantage? Our team is on a mission to empower both strategic and operational decision-making by delivering integrated, forward-looking insights. We combine customer, market, and competitive intelligence to illuminate opportunities and guide strategic moves. As part of our Business Intelligence function, you’ll dive deep into data to uncover differentiating commercial strategies and tactics. Your work will help shape the future by providing clarity in complexity and decisions across the business. If you're ready to influence outcomes and fuel innovation with insight - this is the place to be.
   

  

**We're currently hiring a Business Strategy & Insights Manager** 
 to be part of our Central Business Strategy & Customer Insights team and is based in Region Europe. A successful candidate will be responsible for leading the development and execution of global, business-critical market and competitor insight projects. Collect and analyze data on competitors, industry trends, and market conditions to provide actionable insights for business decisions. Monitor key players, provide regular reports, conduct market and competitive analysis, and support strategy development.
   

  

**What you’ll do at Elekta** 
  

  

 This role provides actionable intelligence to support strategic decision-making, drive profitable growth, and enable the execution of Elekta’s business strategies. The Business Strategy & Insights Manager will shape, scope, and deliver insights that empower stakeholders to make robust, data-driven decisions, working cross-functionally with Sales, Marketing, Business Lines, Regions and other teams across Elekta.
   

  

 Your role will include (but not limited to):
   

  

* Continuous Market Analysis & Monitoring: Develop a deep understanding of the market, customer and competition and closely monitor and report on all major market and competitive activities.
* Lead Market & Competitive Intelligence Initiatives: Establish, drive, and lead a highly effective global intelligence process, including capturing, assessing, and disseminating market, customer, and competitive insights.
* Orchestrate war room on key competitors: Maintain competitive war rooms and play books on top five competitors and deliver competitive insights on a quarterly basis.
* Stakeholder Engagement and Influence: Work closely with stakeholders at all levels to translate information into actionable insight. Lead workshops to define project scope and objectives, ensuring technical feasibility and resource allocation.
* Data Analysis & Reporting: Gather and analyse large volumes of data from multiple sources. Conduct deep-dive analyses and produce clear, actionable intelligence reports tailored to various audiences (e.g., Business Lines, Product Organization, C-level, Executive Board).
* Process & Methodology Development: Introduce and maintain robust processes, guidelines, and documentation. Develop tools and programs that make insights accessible and actionable for stakeholders.
* Continuous Improvement: Contribute to process improvement initiatives and keep all documentation updated on global systems.
* Best Practice: Lead best practice calls and forums to drive actionable insights and foster a culture of intelligence-driven decision-making.
* Project Management: Manage a portfolio of projects and requests, ensuring delivery on time, within scope, and within budget. Coordinate internal and third-party resources, develop project plans, and monitor progress.
* Vendor Identification: Identify best sources of market and competitive information and work with internal colleagues and external vendors to deliver insights based on stakeholder needs.
* Continue monitoring tariff work and reporting on a biweekly basis.


**The Right Capabilities**
* Ability to support the creation of long-term plans that align with company goals.
* Collaborative personality of leadership character with high integrity.
* Hands-on approach with a good ability to switch between an operational and strategic mindset.
* A self-starting attitude, tenacious, pragmatic, and follows things through.
* Strong problem-solving skills, logical and effective in structuring and simplifying complex issues.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills with compelling storytelling capabilities.


**What you’ll bring** 
  

  

* We encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every requirement—your unique skills and experiences might be exactly what we're looking for!


 To be successful in this role, we believe that you have demonstrated experience in a top-tier strategy or management consulting firm. Proven track record working within or consulting for the life science or healthcare industry is of great experience. In addition, we believe you have:
   

  

* A university degree in Business, Engineering or Medicine.
* Demonstrated experience in a top-tier strategy or management consulting firm.
* A strong understanding of business analysis and strategy development.
* Ability to document, visualize and convey messages in an impactful way to a senior audience.
* Experience in driving projects in cross-functional teams across a matrix.


**What you will get** 
  

  

 In this role, you will work for a higher purpose; hope for everyone dealing with cancer, and for everyone regardless of where in the world, to have access to the best cancer care. In addition to this our benefit package includes:
   

  

* 30 paid vacation days/year, additional 4 Elekta days off /year (plus bank holidays)
* Attractive defined contribution pension scheme
* Private Medical Insurance
* Lunch Benefit
* Contribution to wellness activities
* Hybrid work option (you are required to work on location at least 3 days a week)


**Hiring process** 
  

  

 We are looking forward to hearing from you! Apply by submitting your application and résumé in English, via the “Apply” button. Please note that we do not accept applications by e-mail.
   

  

**Your Elekta contact** 
  

  

 For questions, please contact the responsible Global Talent Acquisition Partner, Joanna Kozyra at Joanna.Kozyra@elekta.com.
   

  

**We are an equal opportunity employer.** 
  

  

 We are an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other protected characteristic.

title: Laboratory Technician
description:
ImmunoIVD is seeking a hands-on Lab Technician with experience in GMP or ISO 13485 environments to join our Operations team. The ideal candidate has a background in molecular biology techniques and a passion for maintaining high-quality standards in a regulated setting. In this role, you will be responsible for performing laboratory-based tasks within Production and Quality Control, ensuring that both production schedules and quality requirements are consistently met.
 



  





**About ImmunoIVD** 




 ImmunoIVD AB is dedicated to providing reliable, accessible and innovative assays for newborn screening for SCID, SMA and XLA. Our CE IVD marked SPOT-it™ Screening Kits have been used across Europe since 2018. The assays are highly regarded for their reliability and easy-to-use workflow, requiring minimal laboratory space and equipment investment. We are recognized for our transparent communication and efficient customer support.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Execute production-related tasks in accordance with Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).
* Perform quality control (QC) activities following established SOPs.
* Operate dispensing equipment and semi-automated robotic systems as part of the production process.
* Provide support and act as a substitute for other Operations team members when needed.



  





**Qualifications** 



* Bachelor’s degree (BSc) in a scientific discipline or a Biomedical Scientist (BMA) degree.
* Alternatively, experienced technicians trained in molecular biology techniques are also encouraged to apply.
* 1–2 years of industry experience, with a solid understanding of working in compliance with GMP standards.
* Motivated, driven, and humble individual with a proactive attitude.
* Ability to manage multiple tasks effectively, even under pressure.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills in English.



  





**Competence** 



* Ensures accuracy in documentation, data entry, and experimental execution.
* Skilled in molecular biology techniques, laboratory instrumentation, and process automation tools.
* Understands and consistently applies GMP and QC principles in daily work.
* Works effectively within cross-functional teams and supports colleagues when needed.
* Plans and prioritizes tasks efficiently to meet production and QC timelines.



  





**To apply** 




 It is important to send your CV to - hr@immunoivd.com
 



 The recruitment process will start immediately, so don’t wait to send in your application.

title: Integration Architect
description:
**For a Sustainable Future Together**
 Coop is Sweden's largest cooperative and a leading player in the grocery retail sector, with over 4 million members. We focus heavily on sustainability and work to create a greener and more just future by offering sustainable products and services.
   

  

**At Coop, We Live Our Values Every Day**
* Welcoming: We are inclusive, interested, and considerate in our work to create a positive and supportive work environment.
* Inspiring: We are generous and innovative, passionate about always doing our best for our members.
* Brave: We stand up for what we believe in, are transparent, and dare to lead change.
* Responsible: We deliver on our promises and take responsibility for future generations, both in the workplace and in society.


 We believe that a diversity of perspectives and experiences is key to creating a more inclusive and successful workplace. Therefore, we welcome everyone, regardless of gender, age, background, or ethnic origin.
   

  

**Join Coop – Together, we make Sweden's food landscape sustainable!**
**About The Position**
 We are seeking an experienced Integration Architect to join our IT Integration Team, which is responsible for designing, developing, and supporting integration solutions across the entire organization. In this role, you will play a key part in connecting enterprise applications, and ensuring our integration landscape is secure, scalable, and aligned with our business strategy.
   

  

**Your Role And Responsibilities**
* Design and implement integrations between enterprise applications, including ERP platforms such as SAP S/4HANA.
* Collaborate with architects, application owners, and business stakeholders to translate business requirements into effective integration solutions.
* Ensure technical excellence and consistency through peer reviews, automation, and the definition of development standards and guidelines.
* Evaluate emerging technologies, conduct proofs of concept, and recommend improvements to enhance the integration landscape.
* Provide technical leadership, mentoring, and guidance to develop and support teams to ensure timely and high-quality delivery.


***Who are you?***
 You are an experienced Integration Architect with both technical depth and strategic understanding. You have a genuine interest in how technology enables business and thrive in the space between architecture and execution.
   

  

 You enjoy working collaboratively, guiding others, exchanging ideas, and contributing to a culture where expertise is shared openly. You have the confidence to challenge existing solutions and the curiosity to explore new ones.
   

  

**To Succeed In This Role, We Believe You Have**
* Minimum of 10 years of overall IT experience, including at least 5 years focused on Microsoft Azure architecture and integration design.
* Proven expertise in Azure services such as Function Apps, API Management, Event Grid, Storage, App Services, and Entra ID.
* Strong experience with CI/CD pipelines, version control systems (Azure DevOps, GitHub), and agile delivery methodologies.
* Proficiency in programming languages such as C#, PowerShell, or Python.
* Sound understanding of cloud security, networking principles, and performance optimization.


**It’s a Plus If You Have**
* Experience with SAP S/4HANA integrations, containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), and code quality tools (e.g., SonarQube) is considered an advantage.


 Fluency in both spoken and written English is required, while proficiency in Swedish is a strong plus.
   

  

**What We Offer You**
 We offer you a workplace where you will have the opportunity to grow and develop in an inclusive and inspiring culture. At Coop, you will be part of a dedicated, innovative and skille integration team and contribute to a more sustainable future. We also offer competitive benefits, flexible working hours, and a healthy work–life balance.
   

  

 We work in a hybrid model where you’ll spend around three days per week at our Solna headquarters.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 If you have questions about this assignment, you are welcome to contact Integration Tech Lead Amit Kumar Gupta (amitkumar.gupta@coop.se).
   

  

 We will perform interview continuously so please apply in English with your CV, and some words why you feel you’re a good fit for this role at Coop.

title: Solution Architect
description:
**För En Hållbar Framtid Tillsammans**
 Coop är Sveriges största kooperation och en ledande aktör inom dagligvaruhandeln, med över 4 miljoner medlemmar. Vi har ett stort fokus på hållbarhet och arbetar för att skapa en mer grön och rättvis framtid genom att erbjuda hållbara produkter och tjänster.
   

  

 Vi tror på att en mångfald av perspektiv och erfarenheter är nyckeln till att skapa en mer inkluderande och framgångsrik arbetsplats. Därför välkomnar vi alla oavsett kön, ålder, bakgrund och etnisk tillhörighet.
   

  

**Bli en del av Coop – tillsammans gör vi mat-Sverige hållbart!**
**Om Tjänsten**
 Vill du vara med och forma framtidens hållbara dagligvaruhandel samtidigt som du bidrar till Coops digitala utveckling?
   

  

 Som Solution Architect på Coop Sverige får du en central roll i att säkerställa att våra IT-lösningar stödjer verksamhetens behov och långsiktiga affärsnytta.
   

  

 Du blir en del av Coops centrala IT-organisation inom Affärslösningar och Plattformar, där du arbetar tvärfunktionellt med IT, verksamheten och leverantörer. Här får du kombinera din tekniska kompetens med din förmåga att se helheten och vara rådgivare i frågor som rör arkitektur, systemval och framtida lösningar.
   

  

 I rollen ansvarar du för arkitektur inom pris och sortiment, där SAP är en central del i Coops digitala ekosystem, S/4 Retail plattformen. Du vägleder kring arkitekturprinciper och riktlinjer, säkerställer att våra IT-lösningar realiseras på ett korrekt sätt och att de ger verkligt värde för både affär och kund.
   

  

 Du arbetar strategiskt och operativt, nära både verksamheten och utvecklingsteamen, och deltar i att driva och kvalitetssäkra både större och mindre förändringsinitiativ inom området pris och sortiment.
   

  

**Som Solution Architect Kommer Du Bland Annat Att**
* Ansvara för helhetslösningarnas arkitektur, inklusive integration och livscykelhantering.
* Säkerställa att arkitekturprinciper, riktlinjer och standarder följs och tillämpas.
* Följa upp och kravställa lösningarnas kvalitetsegenskaper som prestanda, skalbarhet och robusthet.
* Granska förändringsinitiativ och projekt utifrån nytta, kostnad och förvaltning.
* Fungera som rådgivare till chefer och team i arkitektur- och designfrågor.
* Bidra till att forma framtida strategier för hur våra IT-lösningar ska stödja verksamheten på bästa sätt.


***Vem är du?***
 Vi söker dig som har en stark teknisk grund, men också förmågan att se till helheten, hur IT och affär samspelar. Du trivs i en rådgivande roll där du får påverka riktning, kvalitet och arbetssätt, och där du samarbetar nära både verksamhet och leverantörer.
   

  

 Som person är du kommunikativ, nyfiken och prestigelös samt att du motiveras av att guida andra, diskutera lösningar och driva förändring tillsammans med kollegor från olika delar av organisationen.
   

  

**För att vara framgångsrik i rollen ser vi att du har:**
* Akademisk utbildning inom IT eller motsvarande erfarenhet.
* Minst 5 års relevant erfarenhet inom IT-arkitektur, SAP eller närliggande område.
* Djup förståelse för SAP som plattform och dess roll i affärsprocesser.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med prissättning och prisprocesser i SAP.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med arkitekturprinciper, integrationer och systemdesign.
* God förståelse för affärsprocesser inom retail.


**Meriterande Om Du Har Erfarenhet Av**
* Deltagit i SAP-utrullningar
* SAP Retail, DMP, DMR
* ABAP (kunna läsa kod)
* Jira and Focused Build
* Blue Yonder eller Demandtec.
* Arbetat med LeanIX eller motsvarande arkitekturverktyg.


**Vårt erbjudande till dig**
 Hos Coop får du vara med och driva den digitala utvecklingen i en av Sveriges mest välkända och värderingsdrivna organisationer. Vi erbjuder en inkluderande och inspirerande kultur, där du får växa och utvecklas tillsammans med engagerade kollegor – alltid med hållbarhet och affärsnytta i fokus.
   

  

 Du får arbeta med moderna lösningar, nära verksamheten och med stort inflytande på framtida arkitekturstrategier. Vi erbjuder också konkurrenskraftiga förmåner, flexibel arbetstid och god balans mellan arbete och fritid.
   

  

**Så Ansöker Du**
 Låter detta som din nästa utmaning? Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt då vi arbetar löpande med urval och intervjuer. För att rättvist matcha kandidater med de krav som rollen ställer kommer vi att använda tester under urvalsarbetet.
   

  

 Om du har några frågor om tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Madeleine Lindskog på e-postadress: Madeleine.Lindskog@coop.se

title: Automation Test Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* You have a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience.
* You have 5+ years of test automation. Having experience in roles in full time test automation.
* You have 3+ years of experience in Playwright — both in developing automation frameworks and authoring/executing scripts.
* You have experience in Cypress
* You have strong scripting skills in TypeScript/JavaScript.
* You have hands-on experience with API testing tools such as Postman or JMeter.
* You are fluent in English, both written and spoken.


**Meritorious**
 Experience in performance testing and test metrics reporting, as well as an understanding of CI/CD pipelines, GitHub Workflows, and Agile methodologies. Previous experience in the telecom industry or with telecom-related projects is also considered an advantage.
   

  

**Application deadline:** 
 18-11-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Infrastrukturspecialist
description:
*We are Posti, a versatile, modern, and international logistics expert with 400 years of experience. Today, we connect people and businesses by delivering information, emotions, and goods with the help of 15,000 experts across the Nordics and Baltics. We make everyday life easier for you, businesses, and society while building a more sustainable future for us all.*
**Infrastrukturspecialist**
 Är du den som ser till att systemen rullar smidigt, dygnet runt? Som gillar att ligga steget före, lösa problem innan de uppstår och skapa stabilitet i en digital värld som aldrig står still? Hos oss får du en central roll i att driva, utveckla och framtidssäkra vår IT-miljö - en miljö som är avgörande för att vår verksamhet ska fungera effektivt varje dag. Nu söker vi en infrastrukturspecialist som kan utgå från något av vara kontor i Jönköping, Nykvarn, Borås, Stockholm, Arlanda eller Skillingaryd.
   

  

**Dina Ansvarsområden**
* Drift och underhåll av servermiljöer (Windows) och nätverkslösningar.
* Säkerställa hög tillgänglighet, prestanda och säkerhet i infrastrukturen.
* Hantera incidenter, felsökning och proaktivt underhåll.
* Delta i kapacitetsplanering och bidra till utveckling av infrastrukturlösningar.
* Implementera och följa säkerhets- och förändringshanteringsprocesser.
* Samarbeta med utvecklingsteam, tekniska projektledare och arkitekter för att stödja leveranser.


**Vi Söker Dig Som**
* Har erfarenhet av serveradministration och nätverkskonfiguration.
* Kunskap om virtualisering, lagring och backup-lösningar.
* Har arbetat med Azure, RDS/AVD, Active Directory och hybridlösningar.
* Förstår IT-säkerhet och kan tillämpa det i sitt ansvarsområde.
* Har ett analytiskt och strukturerat arbetssätt.
* Är lösningsorienterad och trivs med att arbeta i en dynamisk miljö.
* Kan flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift – finska är meriterande


**Vi erbjuder**
* En utmanande roll i ett företag med stark tillväxt och höga ambitioner
* Möjlighet att påverka och förbättra vår tekniska infrastruktur och processer
* Ett lösningsorienterat arbetsklimat med högt i tak
* Ett nära samarbete med Posti Group i Finland och insyn i koncerngemensamma tekniska strategier


**Vill du vara med och bygga en robust och framtidssäker infrastruktur? Ansök idag!**
**If You Have Any Additional Questions, Please Contact**
 Lina.Berg@posti.com
   

  

*Our common values –
 **reliable, respectful, progressive** 
 - guide everything we do. Read more!*

title: German Speaking Sales Development Representative
description:
Featured on The Sunday Times's Top Ten Small Companies to work for, with over a decade's experience recruiting and training the best-in-class SDRs EngageTech offers three solutions; outsourced SDRs, a sales intelligence platform & Managed SDRs. Through the utilization of our outsourced SDR service and our sales intelligence platform businesses can generate qualified leads fast.
 



 Now is the perfect time to come on board, with us expanding into different markets, developing pioneering new service lines, and most excitingly setting up new offices in even more international locations.
 



 We hire on passion and personality, so previous experience isn't paramount, and with our world-class three-month development Sales training program we think almost anyone can be a successful SDR if they wish!
 



 We are looking for individuals to join the outsourced SDR solution.
   

  





**What you'll be doing:** 



* Booking outbound meetings through cold calling
* Also generating outbound meetings through a multi-channel approach of emails, social selling, networking, and independent research
* Establishing genuine relationships with key stakeholders across the business and externally with our different clients
* Engaging with a range of prospects, including C-suite/Directors, from all sorts of different organizations ranging from Blue Chip to the Public Sector
* Lead discovery conversations with prospects on behalf of our clients to unearth challenges and an understanding of digital roadmaps for the coming year


****More about this role:****
* Striving to learn on a day-to-day basis, as well as providing mentorship to those in your team and around you
* Delivering World Class Customer Service for clients at every touchpoint of the process, adhering to best practice
* Work in tandem with clients to manage sales pipeline; maintain impeccable administration and update all activity in our CRM
* Continually act as an ambassador for the EngageTech brand
* Add value to other areas of the business! You have the opportunity to bring your interests and passions outside of your professional life to the role - whether it be sport, Diversity & Inclusion, or Corporate Social Responsibility
* Influence the growth of the overall business
  

  


**Requirements**
* Fluent in German & English
* Articulate, with strong written & verbal communication skills and a talent for building rapport and accelerating relationships
* A desire to work with lots of different stakeholders, be they clients, colleagues, managers, or prospects
* An interest or affinity with the Tech industry
* Simple, but a can-do, positive mindset
* Have the flexibility to thrive in a scale-up, high-growth environment where things are constantly evolving
* Accountable for your actions and input on a day-to-day basis
* Appreciative of the value of solid relationships with your colleagues
* Relish the opportunity to have continuous learning and development
  

  


**Benefits**
* Investment into personal development, with a clear personalized plan to achieve your goals
* Uncapped Commission
* Hybrid-working with a sociable office and the opportunity to work from home
* A three-month SDR training program to unlock your potential
* Mental Health support, with chat therapy courses available
* Opportunities to; travel, work and learn in one of our international locations, including; Stockholm, Edinburgh and Cape Town
* Working equipment provided, including new laptops
* 6 months full maternity pay, with a basket of "Month One" baby supplies
* Quarterly incentives such as ‘Diamond Club' Michelin meals
* Company incentive trips away to places including Ibiza, Milan & Tenerife
* Women in Tech and Diversity & Inclusion Initiatives
* Sabbatical opportunity after one year
* Gym subsidization in London
* Breakfast & snacks in the office
* 25 Days Annual Leave

title: IT-arkitekt med fokus på infrastruktur och integrationsplattform
description:
*Vill du vara med och forma framtidens digitala infrastruktur i en av Sveriges mest framåtlutade kommuner? Vi söker nu en drivande IT-arkitekt med djup förståelse för modern infrastruktur och drift i ett komplext systemlandskap där flera systemleverantörer samverkar. Rollen innebär ett totalt ägandeskap för stadens infrastrukturfrågor, med särskilt fokus på vår integrationsplattform.*
**Om oss**
 Solna stad är en av Sveriges mest expansiva och dynamiska kommuner. Digitalisering och IT genomsyrar hela vår verksamhet – från skola och omsorg till fastigheter och stadsutveckling. På IT-enheten är vi 25 engagerade kollegor som tillsammans med våra drift- och systempartners skapar en stabil, säker och flexibel IT-plattform som möjliggör stadens fortsatta digitala resa. Vi sitter centralt i Solna centrum, nära verksamheten och besluten. Här får du både ansvar, handlingsutrymme och möjlighet att påverka – i en miljö där teknik, innovation och samhällsnytta möts.
   

  

**Några ord från rekryterande chef Pierre Ahlby**
*”Hos oss handlar det inte bara om teknik – det handlar om att skapa förtroende, samarbete och rörelse framåt. Vi söker dig som vill ta ansvar för helheten, driva förbättringar och bygga struktur i en komplex och spännande miljö. Här får du friheten att påverka vägen framåt, i ett team där idéer blir verklighet och där utveckling är en naturlig del av vardagen.”*
**Vi erbjuder**
* En arbetsplats med tydligt fokus på utveckling och ansvar.
* Möjlighet till distansarbete när arbetet tillåter.
* Friskvårdsbidrag, semesterväxling och löneväxling till pension.
* Ett team som stöttar varandra och där idéer får genomslag.


**Vad innebär rollen?**
 Som IT-arkitekt hos oss får du en central och strategisk roll. Du arbetar tvärs över både verksamhet, driftspartner och systemleverantörer och driver förbättringar, modernisering och nyetablering av vår IT-arkitektur. Du ansvarar för att våra infrastrukturtjänster är framtidssäkrade, robusta och samspelar effektivt med verksamhetens system.
   

  

* Ta ett ägandeskap över infrastrukturfrågor, med fokus på stadens integrationsplattform.
* Driva förbättringar och vidareutveckling av IT-arkitektur och tekniska plattformar.
* Leda och samordna infrastrukturfrågor mot driftspartner och systemleverantörer.
* Säkra att helhetsarkitekturen stödjer både verksamhetsmål och tekniska krav.
* Delta i planering, upphandling och styrning av tekniska förändringar.
* Säkerställa hög tillgänglighet, prestanda och säkerhet i stadens IT-miljö.
* Stötta Solnas digitaliseringsarbete och bidra med teknisk kompetens – särskilt inom integrationslösningar.


**Vem är du?**
 Du är en strukturerad, nyfiken och kommunikativ IT-arkitekt som trivs i gränslandet mellan strategi och teknik. Du har ett djupgående tekniskt kunnande inom infrastruktur och integrationslösningar, och du gillar att ta initiativ och driva saker i mål tillsammans med andra.
   

  

* Relevant högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande erfarenhet.
* Erfarenhet av infrastrukturarkitektur och komplexa IT-miljöer.
* Förmåga att driva frågor mot externa driftspartner och leverantörer.
* Kunskap om integrationsarkitektur, gärna med erfarenhet av BPMN & low-code.
* Erfarenhet av förändringsledning och teknisk utveckling.
* Förmåga att kommunicera tydligt på svenska, både muntligt och skriftligt.


 Det är meriterande om du har en bakgrund som utvecklare och kan stötta i tekniska frågor vid behov.
   

  

 Som person är du social och engagerad – en sann lagspelare som tycker lika mycket om att arbeta med människor som med teknik. Ansvarstagande, lösningsorienterad och driven. En person som ser helheten och skapar struktur även i komplexa miljöer.
   

  

**Mer information om ansökan**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid med önskat tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan senast den
 **7 december** 
 .
   

  

 Vid frågor om tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Pierre Ahlby, Chef för IT-arkitektur på pierre.ahlby@solna.se.
   

  

 Vill du arbeta i en stad där teknik och samhällsnytta går hand i hand?
   

  

 Välkommen till Solna stad – framtidens stad, mitt i händelsernas centrum.
   

  

 Vi tar enbart emot ansökningar via vårt rekryteringssystem. Solna stad har gjort medieval för samtliga rekryteringar, så vi undanber oss därför samtal från annonssäljare eller säljare av rekryteringstjänster.
   

  

 I Solna arbetar engagerade medarbetare med uppdraget att utveckla staden och välfärden med solnaborna i fokus. Detta gör oss till en spännande och utvecklande organisation att arbeta inom.
   

  

 Stadsledningsförvaltningens uppgift är att biträda kommunstyrelsen med ledning och styrning av övergripande och strategiska frågor.
   

  

 Solna är en framtidsstad i tillväxt, unikt belägen mellan Kungliga nationalstadsparkens lugn och storstadens puls. Vår vision är att Solna ska vara en levande och trygg stad, som förenar hållbar utveckling med en god ekonomisk hushållning för att trygga framtidens välfärd. Här finns attraktiva bostäder, framgångsrika företag, utmärkta kommunikationer, förstklassig samhällsservice och ett rikt kultur- och idrottsutbud. Solna stad är nu inne i en spännande utvecklingsfas, befolkningen växer och många företag söker sig hit.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100 | Ort: Solna | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/491 | Kontakt: Pierre Ahlby 087463750, | Publicerat: 2025-11-11 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-12-07

title: .NET utvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Minst 7 års dokumenterad arbetslivserfarenhet av .NET-utveckling
* Minst 5 års dokumenterad arbetslivserfarenhet av SQL och Oracle RDBMS
* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att införa lösningar i IT-miljöer med flertalet systemintegrationer
* Dokumenterad arbetslivserfarenhet av att utveckla API:er som kan importeras, hanteras och integreras i Mulesoft-plattformen enligt plattformens standarder. Erfarenhet inom de senaste 3 åren
* Dokumenterad arbetslivserfarenhet av kontinuerlig integration med OpenShift och ArgoCD. Erfarenhet inom de senaste 3 åren
* Dokumenterad arbetslivserfarenhet av webbutveckling med Blazor. Erfarenhet inom de senaste 3 åren


**Meriterande**
* Dokumenterad arbetslivserfarenhet avverktygen Kibana, Git, Jira, Confluence, Jenkins, AMQ, JMS Toolbox, Bitbucket och Kubeseal
* Dokumenterad arbetslivserfarenhet av Serilog, REST/SOAP, Hangfire, Minimal APIs, JWT, Mediator och ReactJS
* Dokumenterad arbetslivserfarenhet av testramverken xUnit och bUnit samt automatiska Postmantester med Newman
* Dokumenterad arbetslivserfarenhet avutveckla och generera PDF-dokument med Apache FOP och Adobe AEM, inklusive hantering av dokumentstruktur, layout och formatering.
* Dokumenterad arbetslivserfarenhet av att underhålla och vidareutveckla legacy-kod


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 26-11-2025
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.
   

  

 Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Full-Stack Frontend Engineer
description:
With an R&D hub in 
 **Solna** 
 , 
 **Sweden** 
 , and a production site in 
 **Gdańsk** 
 , 
 **Poland** 
 , Scania Industrial Batteries build digital products that connect industrial battery systems with real-time data, analytics, and automation - enabling the electrification of heavy industries such as construction, mining, and marine.
 



  





 We are now looking for an experienced 
 **Full-Stack Frontend Engineer** 
 to join our Software Engineering team.
 



  





 In this role, you’ll build end-to-end web and desktop applications that interact with embedded systems, IoT data, and cloud services - bridging the physical and digital worlds. You’ll own the frontend, designing and developing intuitive, performant interfaces using React and TypeScript for web and frameworks like Electron for desktop. On the backend, you’ll contribute to APIs and services built in Node.js, Go, or Python, deployed on AWS, and help shape system architecture and data flow for reliability and scalability. You will collaborate with Cloud Engineers on CI/CD pipelines, automated testing, and infrastructure automation, and drive product quality through documentation, coding standards, and observability. Working closely with Embedded and Cloud Engineers as well as Product Stakeholders, you’ll turn complex data into insight and action - shaping how users experience our digital products.
 



  





 We asked some of your future colleagues what makes this role special. Among many things, they highlighted that your code interacts with real hardware, and not just APIs. It will be used far below ground, at sea and in remote locations few people ever reach. You will influence the UX and interface design without a dedicated UX team, and build both web and desktop applications that bring our battery systems to life.
 



  





**Benefits** 



* 30 days of vacation
* Working Time Reduction
* Yearly wellness allowance
* Pension
* Parental benefit
* Flexible working hours



  





**Skills & Requirements** 




 We are looking for someone with
 


* Extensive experience of software development, including modern frontend frameworks.
* Deep proficiency in TypeScript and React (architecture, performance optimization).
* Backend experience (Node.js / Go / Python; APIs, data models, integrations).
* Experience working with cloud infrastructure (preferably AWS).
* Knowledge of REST or GraphQL APIs, and SQL or NoSQL databases.
* Comfortable with CI/CD pipelines, versioning, and automated testing.



  





 It's an advantage if you have
 


* A degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or other related field.
* Built desktop apps (Electron, Tauri, or similar).
* Been exposed to embedded/IoT systems, telemetry, or real-time data flows.
* Experience with design systems or leading UI/UX decisions.



  





 Further, we believe that you are
 


* Someone that take ownership and enjoy autonomy - especially around UI and UX decisions.
* A structured problem-solver, balancing user needs with technical pragmatism.
* A colleague with collaborative mindset - comfortable working with Cloud and Embedded teams.
* Curious, adaptable, and motivated by seeing your work in real customer environments.
* Passionate about building high-quality, production-ready software.
* Friendly, passionate, and purpose-driven teammate who brings positive energy and shared ambition to every challenge.

title: Senior Manager - Digital Strategy and IT Operating Model within Management Consulting
description:
**About The Role**
 As a Senior Manager in Technology Strategy & IT Operations within Management Consulting at KPMG, you will play a pivotal role in guiding our clients through their digital transformation journeys. You will leverage your expertise in digital strategy, IT operating models, and technology transformation to help clients achieve their business objectives. This role requires a deep understanding of digital technologies, strategic thinking, and the ability to contribute and lead complex projects.
   

  

 Your impact, adaptability and growth mindset matter as much as your years in the field. You will take on client solution development and project delivery leadership. You will contribute actively to practice building, growth, mentoring and thought leadership.
   

  

 The role can be placed in Stockholm or Gothenburg, depending on your location and preference.
   

  

**Our Fields of Engagement**
* Digital Strategy Development: Collaborate with clients to develop comprehensive digital strategies that align with their business goals and objectives. This includes assessing current digital capabilities, identifying opportunities for improvement or developing futuristic roadmaps for digital transformation
* IT Operating Model Design: Design and implement future ready IT operating models that enhance efficiency, scalability and agility. This involves defining organization model, governance and steering model for IT, Business-IT Alignment, IT processes, Service delivery efficiency, performance KPIs and roles that complement client's digital strategy
* IT Strategic Sourcing: Analyze and optimize IT sourcing strategy, supplier landscape and IT spend to ensure value for money. This involves conducting cost-benefit analysis, benchmarking, reviewing supplier performance and identifying opportunities for cost savings.
