Additionally, support client with complex and strategic sourcing initiatives (RFx process)
* CIO advisory: Build and maintain strong relationships with clients Tech/IT leadership acting as a trusted advisor. Understand CxO business and IT challenges and provide tailored and optimal solutions, insights
* Thought Leadership: Stay abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies. Contribute to thought leadership by presenting at conferences, and participating in industry forums and developing articles, point of views and surveys


 ,
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in information technology, Business Administration, or a related field
* Minimum of 10+ years of relevant experience in Digital/Technology strategy, IT Operating model, IT Service delivery and Steering Model transformation, cost transformation, or Technology transformation roles
* Experience from top-tier consulting firms or large enterprises is preferred
* Deep understanding of cloud strategy and cloud transformation, emerging technologies (AI, Gen & Agentic AI, Modern Data platforms) or IT infrastructure & IT operations
* Understanding of Enterprise Architecture concepts, Industry leading platforms across functions (e.g. ERP, CRM, CPQ, e-commerce, Supply chain & Logistics, Data Platforms)
* Proven experience in leading complex projects and delivering high-quality results under tight deadlines
* Proven experience in sales within a consulting environment including identifying business opportunities, developing proposals and driving business growth
* Curious with attitude of continuous learning
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* Proactive, entrepreneurial and collaborative mindset
* Excellent stakeholder management skills. Comfortable in engaging with CxO level stakeholders in dynamic and high impact situation.
* Proficiency (written and spoken) in Swedish will be considered plus


**Why Join KPMG**
* Global Network: Be part of a global network of professionals and gain access to international projects and knowledge sharing
* Career Development: Benefit from continuous learning and development opportunities, including training courses, mentorship programs, and career progression pathways
* Inclusive Culture: Work in an inclusive and diverse environment where everyone's ideas and contributions are valued
* Impactful Work: Make a lasting, positive impact on clients and society through meaningful and challenging work


 At KPMG, we are committed to fostering a culture of integrity, excellence, and collaboration. We believe in empowering our people to make a positive impact on our clients, communities, and society. Our values guide our actions and help us achieve our vision of being the preferred insights-led professional services firm.
   

  

 If you are a strategic thinker with a passion for digital transformation and a commitment to excellence, we invite you to join our team at KPMG and help us shape the future of our clients' businesses.
   

  

**Make a difference with us?**
 We welcome and look forward to receiving your application also during the summer, the selection process will begin at the start of August.
   

  

 If you have any questions, please contact Marie-Louise Bååth, marie-louise.baath@kpmg.se

title: Fullstackutvecklare inom Risk & Hälsa
description:
**Att jobba som fullstackutvecklare**
 I rollen som fullstackutvecklare kommer du vara med på vår digitaliseringsresa inom försäkringsområdet där du är med och utvecklar den tekniska plattform som kommer ligga till grund för Skandias nya försäkringsportal. Portalen kommer att samla självservicetjänster, information om erbjudanden samt inloggnings- och behörighetsflöden. Du kommer även arbeta med våra centrala betalnings- och ekonomiflöden kopplat till Skandias försäkringsaffären. Ett område som är avgörande för att våra kunder ska vara trygga och utvecklas för framtida generationer.
   

  

 Teamet arbetar både med nyutveckling och med att modernisera befintliga system alltid med kvalitet och kundnytta i fokus. Du blir en viktig del i ett team med bred teknisk kompetens och ett tätt samarbete där vi jobbar med allt från kravförståelse till testautomatisering. Teamet består idag av Product Owner/Teamcoach, mjukvaruarkitekt (50 %), tre systemutvecklare och testare alla med placerade i Stockholm.
   

  

 Vi arbetar hybrid vilket innebär arbete på kontoret varvat med distansarbete. I rollen kommer du att rapportera till gruppchef IT rådgivning.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen**
 Vi söker dig som har flera års erfarenhet av systemutveckling i .NET-miljö och som känner dig bekväm i både frontend- och backendutveckling. Du har arbetat med tekniker som .NET Core och Framework i backend samt React och typescript i frontend. Vi ser även att du har kunskap inom databashantering SQL server samt Rest API. Ett grundkrav för rollen är att du kan kommunicera flytande på svenska, både i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Som person är du strukturerad, nyfiken på nya lösningar och trivs med att jobba tillsammans i team. Du delar gärna med dig av din kunskap, gillar att ta ansvar och är inte rädd för att ställa frågor. Vi tror att du är kommunikativ och öppen, och att du ser styrkan i att arbeta tillsammans även tvärfunktionellt med andra team.
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kring rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Carina Sundelius på carina.sundelius@skandia.se.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kopplat till rekryteringsprocess, vänligen ta kontakt med Harald Brehmer, Talent Acquisition Partner IT på harald.brehmer@skandia.se
   

  

 Vi kommer att återkoppla till alla som söker oavsett om du går vidare eller inte.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Mer om IT**
 Vi på Skandia IT är stolta över att vara en kundorienterad enhet som levererar effektiva och säkra lösningar för våra kunder. Med cirka 600 engagerade medarbetare är vi mitt i en spännande transformationsresa, där vi utvecklas tillsammans och har kul på vägen. Framåt tillsammans är vårt motto!
   

  

 Vi arbetar agilt och har sedan 2017 använt oss av SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) ramverket, där leverans och kundvärde alltid står i centrum. Våra tågledningar och team, jobbar verksamhetsbaserat med aktiviteter som sprintplanering, daily stand-ups, team-synk, code reviews och retrospektiv.
   

  

 Var 12:e vecka samlas vi alla i vår ljusa och inspirerande Ljusgård på kontoret i Stockholm för 2 planeringsdagar. Planeringsperioden består av 6 tvåveckorssprintar, där den sista sprinten är en innovationssprint. Här får du chansen att, själv eller tillsammans med ditt team, utveckla och förfina våra system.

title: Head of Infrastructure & Security
description:
**Xensam: Join the Future of SAM**
 Xensam is the leader in AI-powered, cloud-based Software Asset Management. Our technology gives clarity in complex IT environments, helping every user make smart, data-driven decisions and maximize software ROI.
   

  

 We’re scaling fast and looking for people who want to join the journey. At Xensam, you play a key role in a team built on energy, focus, and positivity. We value experience, but even more, the person behind it.
   

  

 Together, we build the future of SAM.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As our Head of Infrastructure and Security, you will build and evolve the secure, reliable and scalable foundation that enables our rapid growth. You’ll lead our Infrastructure & Security team, covering cloud hosting, pipelines, internal IT, security, compliance and QA - while shaping strategy and guiding our technology roadmap.
   

  

 This is a high-impact role where you’ll work closely with the CTO, Product Managers, Engineering Managers, and Commercial leadership to ensure our platform is fast, stable, and secure.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 You will lead and grow the Infrastructure & Security team, mentoring and developing staff to perform at their best. You will also own and evolve our cloud infrastructure for scalability, availability, performance, and security. Furthermore, you will:
   

  

* Oversee SaaS hosting environments, CI/CD pipelines, and automation to accelerate product delivery.
* Drive observability, incident response readiness, and ensure uptime/reliability targets are met.
* Lead Internal IT operations, integrations, and tooling for the company.
* Oversee QA specialists, driving quality assurance across product teams and building a sustainable in-house QA function.
* Own accountability for IT Security & Compliance, embedding security into infrastructure and operations.
* Act as escalation point and key interface for leadership, enterprise customers, and auditors on security matters.
* Lead a team of 4-8 people while also scaling the team going forward.


**Qualifications**
* 5+ years of experience in the field, with 3–5 years in a leadership/management role.
* Strong background in infrastructure and cloud operations within SaaS environments.
* Proven experience in building, mentoring, and leading cross-functional teams (DevOps, Security, QA).
* Ability to balance strategic vision with hands-on technical engagement.
* Solid knowledge of IT Security, compliance frameworks, audits, and enterprise SaaS requirements.
* Excellent collaboration and communication skills across technical and commercial stakeholders.


**What You Get**
* A generous work culture with free drinks and snacks, office massages, and more.
* Three days in-office (with remote work on Mondays and Fridays).
* An opportunity to shape your career growth while contributing to the company’s success.
* A dynamic position embracing "freedom under responsibility".
* If sales targets are met, all employees enjoy an annual destination trip.
* Other location-specific benefits.


**Our values at Xensam**
**Rebellious**
 We challenge the norm and act with initiative – always with responsibility.
   

  

**Humane**
 We foster a caring, inclusive environment that values diversity and respects individuality.
   

  

**Harmony**
 We value balance and create a supportive workplace where people thrive.
   

  

 As part of our recruitment process, we conduct background checks on final candidates to fulfill our commitments to customers and ensure a safe work environment.
   

  

 Xensam is the leading provider of AI-powered Software Asset Management technology. Designed to provide SAM Managers and IT Leaders with valuable data, our platform offers a wealth of features to simplify SAM workloads with built-in automation and advanced functionality. We prioritize ease of use and industry-leading security for both On-premise and Cloud software, putting organizations in total control of their hybrid IT environments.

title: Field Sales Specialist B2B at Wolt
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 1000 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a
 **Sales Specialist at Wolt** 
 , you’ll be at the forefront of our growth and we want you to be our deal-closer towards restaurants, retailers, and other local businesses. You’ll identify potential partners, pitch the value of Wolt, and work closely with merchants to onboard them successfully onto our platform.
   

  

 With solid product knowledge, you will clearly communicate how Wolt can strengthen businesses and provide tailored solutions to meet customer needs. In addition, you will work closely with other internal departments to ensure a smooth transition from sales to implementation and support.
   

  

 We are looking for someone who truly wants to grow and develop within sales. At Wolt, ambition is the key to success – and we believe it’s your personality and potential that define how far you can go.
   

  

 This role is open to candidates with different levels of sales experience. Whether you’re building on a strong foundation and eager to take the next step, or you already have extensive experience driving complex sales and shaping sales strategies, Wolt will provide the platform for you to thrive. What matters most is your drive, curiosity, and willingness to succeed.
   

  

**What You'll Be Doing**
* Prospect and generate leads to identify potential new partners (restaurants, grocery stores, and retail shops)
* Pitch and negotiate with decision-makers, demonstrating how Wolt can add value to their business
* Close deals and manage contracts to ensure a smooth onboarding process
* Collaborate with internal teams (e.g., Account Management, Operations, Marketing) to guarantee partners’ success after launch


 Our humble expectations
   

  

* Previous B2B sales experience, preferably in restaurant sales or retail
* Excellent command of Swedish and English. Speaking another language is a big plus
* Willingness to travel extensively, as the role involves significant travel with overnight stays across Sweden (up to 75% of your working time)
* A driver’s license is not required, but considered a strong plus


 In addition to formal requirements, we will place great emphasis on your personal qualities and your interest in the role and Wolt as a company. Please be sure to clearly motivate in your application why you are applying.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

 At Wolt, you get the best of both worlds: the dynamic energy of a scale-up with a highly sought-after product, combined with the stability of a well-established company with strong owners and a long-term outlook.
   

  

* A unique opportunity to join a growth journey where your ideas about the direction of the company are welcome, and where you can contribute to developing new tools and ways of working
* A Competitive Salary Package and Benefits


 Next steps
   

  

 If you are excited about working in a high-growth environment, taking ownership, and being part of an extremely ambitious team, then click below to apply and get the conversation going!
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: IT projektledare till Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset
description:
Vill du vara med och driva några av de mest komplexa och samhällsviktiga IT-projekten inom svensk hälso- och sjukvård? Vi söker en IT-projektledare till avdelningen för Strategi & Styrning på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset. Här får du en central roll i att utveckla och samordna verksamhetskritiska initiativ, där struktur, operativt arbete och samarbete står i fokus.
   

  

**Du erbjuds**
* möjligheten att arbeta på ett av världens bästa sjukhus där vi bedriver högspecialiserad vård i framkant
* möjligheten att driva verksamhetskritiska projekt där IT-system och arbetssätt förändras.
* Tvärfunktionellt arbete med vård, IT, förändringsledning och leverantörer.
* En arbetsmiljö med hög komplexitet och stor påverkan på sjukvårdens framtid.


 Självklart får du också ta del av våra generella förmåner som Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset erbjuder dig.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Verksamhetsområdet IT (VO IT) på Karolinska Universitetssjukhus innefattar ca. 230 medarbetare inom 8 olika avdelningar som arbetar för att möjliggöra sjukvården genom att leverera en robust och välutvecklad IT miljö. I VO IT uppdraget ingår drift, förvaltning och utveckling av sjukhusets tekniska lösningar, så att vi kan erbjuda vård, forskning och utbildning av högsta klass.
   

  

 Ett effektivt IT-arbete bygger på tydliga processer och samverkan mellan olika aktörer– mellan olika team inom VO IT, med sjukhusets olika verksamheter samt med externa intressenter och leverantörer.
   

  

 Som IT projektledare kommer du att ansvara för att leda stora initiativ som drivs inom VO IT. Fokus ligger på att säkerställa att arbetet går i linje med den strategiska riktningen och drivs på i enighet med ITs arbetssätt, leveransmodell och portföljstyrning.
   

  

 Exempel på pågående och kommande projekt:
   

  

* Införande av nya IT-system inom vårdverksamheten
* Integrationer med nationella tjänster och register
* Förändrade arbetssätt kopplade till digital dokumentation och informationsdelning


**Vi söker dig som**
* Har en stark leveransförmåga och trivs med att arbeta i komplexa miljöer
* Du är lyhörd, strukturerad och har väldigt god samarbetsförmåga
* Helhetssyn och stark egen drivkraft är en självklarhet för dig
* Trivs i en miljö med många intressenter
* Har stark kommunikationsförmåga
* Är van att driva förändring


 Vi lägger stor vikt på personlig lämplighet.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 Krav:
   

  

* Akademisk examen, exempelvis inom systemvetenskap, teknik, vård eller annan utbildning som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdig
* Erfarenhet av projektledning av stora och komplexa projekt
* Har dokumenterad förmåga att leda komplexa IT-projekt från start till mål
* Erfarenhet av förändringsledning
* Erfarenhet av portfölj- och projektstyrning
* Erfarenhet av agila arbetssätt
* Vana att arbeta med flera intressenter, ofta med olika mål och perspektiv
* Mycket god kommunikationsförmåga
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska, både tal och skrift


 Meriterande:
   

  

* Certifiering inom projektledning (t.ex. PMP, PRINCE2)
* Erfarenhet av att leda externfinansierade projekt
* Erfarenhet från vård


**Om rekryteringsprocessen**
 Urval och intervjuer kan komma att ske löpande under ansökningstiden.
   

  

 I samband med din ansökan behöver du bifoga CV. Istället för ett personligt brev ber vi dig besvara urvalsfrågor samt kort motivera varför du passar för rollen. Att besvara frågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan - Tillsammans är vi Karolinska!
   

  

 Inför tillsättning av befattning som innefattar vård av barn och ungdom, kontrolleras den som erbjuds tjänsten mot misstanke- och belastningsregistret. Här kan du läsa mer om rekryteringsprocessen och om vilka kontroller som utförs på Karolinska.
   

  

 Som anställd på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset kan du komma att krigsplaceras. Läs mer om vad det innebär här.
   

  

 Om du är eller tidigare har varit anställd i Region Stockholm kommer vi att ta interna referenser från din nuvarande eller tidigare chef, om du blir aktuell för anställning.
   

  

 För tillsvidaretjänster kan provanställning komma att tillämpas.
   

  

**Om Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset**
 Vi på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset är stolta över att vi är ett av världens främsta universitetssjukhus. Förutom vårt särskilda ansvar för den högspecialiserade vården i Stockholmsregionen är huvuduppdraget att tillsammans med Karolinska Institutet utbilda framtidens vårdanställda och bedriva världsledande forskning samtidigt som vi fortsätter vårt arbete med att utveckla vården för patientens bästa. Vi arbetar inom en rad olika områden och professioner.
   

  

 Vår vision - Vi ska bota och lindra imorgon det ingen kan bota och lindra idag.
   

  

 Läs gärna mer om oss på karolinska.se och följ oss på sociala medier!
   

  

 Att söka jobb i Region Stockholm Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser. Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen. Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidare med provanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/7001 | Kontakt: Rekryterande chef Jeanette Tuval jeanette.tuval@regionstockholm.se, | Facklig företrädare: SACO saco.karolinska.karolinska@regionstockholm.se, Ledarna ledarna.karolinska@regionstockholm.se, Vision vision.karolinska@regionstockholm.se, Kommunal kommunal.karolinska@regionstockholm.se, | Publicerat: 2025-11-13 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-11-27

title: Teknisk Plattformsägare Microsoft 365
description:
Vill du bygga och leda utvecklingen av vår Microsoft 365- och Azure-miljö? Vi söker en teknisk plattformsägare som vill ta helhetsansvaret och driva vår IT-miljö framåt. I rollen får du möjlighet att forma en modern, stabil och framtidssäker plattform som används av hela koncernen.
 



  





**Om tjänsten** 




 Som Teknisk Plattformsägare kommer du att ansvara för att förvalta, utveckla och driva vår Microsoft 365- och Azure-miljö på både domän- och klientnivå. Du arbetar med att hantera identiteter, åtkomst, behörighetsstyrning och säkerhetskonfigurationer i Microsoft Entra ID samt administrera och vidareutveckla Teams, SharePoint, Exchange Online och övriga M365-tjänster. I tjänsten blir du en nyckelperson i att bygga en säker, stabil och skalbar infrastruktur för vår verksamhet och våra systerbolag.
 



  





 Du kommer bland annat att arbeta med:
 


* Design och implementering av Azure-resurser med fokus på säkerhet, skalbarhet och kostnadseffektivitet
* Etablering och förvaltning av styrmodeller för Azure governance, policyer och kostnadsstyrning
* Automatisering och effektivisering av driftsprocesser med hjälp av Infrastructure as Code (Bicep, ARM, Terraform eller motsvarande)



  





 Du kommer att ingå i vår IT-avdelning med 11 kollegor, där ni tillsammans ansvarar för drift och utveckling av vår IT-miljö, samtidigt som du samarbetar nära med alla övriga kollegor i företaget. Teamet präglas av en stark laganda och ett nära samarbete, där man stöttar varandra och arbetar mot gemensamma mål.
 



  





**Vem vi söker** 




 För att passa i tjänsten söker vi dig som har relevant erfarenhet inom IT och som trivs i en roll där du får kombinera teknisk kompetens med problemlösning och samarbete. För att vara framgångsrik i tjänsten ser vi att du har erfarenhet av Microsoft 365 och Azure, god förståelse för nätverk och infrastruktur samt vana vid felsökning i både klient- och servermiljö. Kunskaper inom IT-säkerhet, scripting eller automatisering är meriterande.
 



  





**Vi ser gärna att du har** 
 :
 


* Flera års erfarenhet av utveckling, drift och förvaltning av Microsoft 365 och Azure i företagsmiljö
* God kunskap om domänhantering, klientintegration, identitetshantering och hybridmiljöer
* Erfarenhet av säkerhets- och compliance-funktioner samt nätverk
* Meriterande: erfarenhet av scripting, automatisering och arbete i större IT-miljöer



  





 För att lyckas i rollen har du ett personligt engagemang och förmåga att prioritera i en miljö med många intressenter. Du är noggrann, kvalitetsmedveten och har lätt för att samarbeta, samtidigt som du kan driva ditt arbete framåt självständigt.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Skicka din ansökan genom att klicka på knappen ”Join us!” under annonsen. Skicka gärna din ansökan snarast då urvalet sker löpande, dock senast 10/10. Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mejl p.g.a. GDPR. Kontakta gärna Emma Persson, Talent Acquisition & People Partner på epr@cparta.se om du har några frågor om tjänsten.
 



  





 Välkommen med din ansökan!
 



  





*Erbjudanden från rekryteringsföretag/annonssäljare undanbedes.*

title: Senior Product Manager
description:
As a Senior Product Manager, you will ensure that the cards and account top-up experiences are so simple, intuitive and scalable that it becomes an automated and frictionlessly journey of the customer's financial life. Your ultimate goal: simplify and scale the card and account top up capabilities, so that it becomes highly automated and built for hyper-personal experiences.
 



 At Lunar, we are democratizing the power of money and changing the way we all bank, pay, and invest. Since starting in Aarhus in 2015, we've grown rapidly and are now a major player in the Nordics, with offices in Copenhagen, Aarhus, and Stockholm 🚀
 



 So, who are we? Are we a tech company or a bank? Well, we're both breaking free from the usual categories. At Lunar, tech isn't just a cool add-on; it's the core of how we do things. With our own banking license, we go head-to-head with traditional banks. What sets us apart is the mix of tech and financial services, giving us the power to shake up a dusty industry that's ready for a change.
 



 As we continue our journey to becoming the best everyday bank in the Nordics, we are looking for a/an {insert role} to {insert brief role purpose} so that we can {insert brief business driver}.
   





**What will you do?** 



* Product Strategy & roadmap: Define the strategy for card payments and account-top-ups that aligns with our Nordic presence ambitions, our core Invisible Banking differentiator and our Scalable banking mantra. Translate this into a clear roadmap.
* Product Lifecycle: Lead the development of card issuing & processing and account-top-ups payment solutions for Lunar customers. Work intimately with Engineering (and other stakeholders) to build a hyper-efficient foundation.
* Scale & compliance: Build and run a foundation that ensures our payment infrastructure is robust, fast, and compliant (PSD2, GDPR, etc.), turning scalability into a competitive advantage for our growth.
* Vendor & Innovation pipeline: Proactively manage key partners and vendors, ensuring they power our future vision and feed an innovation pipeline that keeps Lunar at the cutting edge of fintech.
* Performance: Be data-driven, defining and monitoring KPIs that measure effortlessness and efficiency, not just usage.



**What are we looking for in you?** 




 We're excited to welcome everyone to apply for this impactful role! We can’t wait to follow up with talents who we believe are the best fit based on the following criteria:
 


* Domain mastery (5+ years): Deep, hands-on experience in product management with a focus on payment products within a regulated fintech or banking environment.
* Payments expertise: A strong understanding of the payments ecosystem, including card network rules (Visa/Mastercard), alternative payment methods foundations and payments processing flows.
* Technical acumen: The ability to understand complex system architecture and engage effectively with engineering teams to build a fast, low-cost, high-velocity foundation for growth.
* Strategic Leadership: Proven ability to define a product strategy, influence stakeholders across the organization (including senior leadership), and be able to guide and motivate a high-performing team.
* Nordic focus (desirable): Experience or a strong understanding of the unique Nordic payments landscape and its regulatory environment.



**Curious about the Lunar culture? 💚** 




 Everything at Lunar centers around our core - to challenge. It’s infused into our four values and guides us in how to work together, lead projects, and lead people to reach our mission. Our values aren't just words on a page - they're what make us who we are and shape the vibe of our culture. And trust me, we’re all about the vibe. For a longer read about our culture, click here.
 



  

**Are you ready to join the journey? Apply now and let's find out more!** 




 While you hold on tight for us to get back to you, curious to see what we’re up to? Follow us on LinkedIn for business announcements and releases 📢, check out our Instagram for an inside scoop on what it’s like to work here 📸, and visit our blog for the latest tech and product insights! 📱🫰
 



*Depending on the regulations in the country where you will be employed, we will ask to see or obtain information about your criminal record.*

title: Solutions Engineer (all genders)
description:
Join TeamViewer, the leader in remote connectivity software. We harness the potential of cutting-edge technologies such as Augmented Reality and Artificial Intelligence to push the boundaries of innovation and shape the future of digitalization.
   

  

 Our team of more than 1,500 employees spans different continents, cultures and disciplines. With our inclusive values, we celebrate the unique perspectives and talents each individual brings to the table and foster a dynamic work environment where new ideas thrive.
   

  

 Become part of our winning team and help us create a world that works better.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 With the launch of TeamViewer ONE, we are taking the next step: a fully integrated digital workplace platform that unites remote connectivity (powered by TeamViewer Tensor), endpoint management, digital employee experience (DEX), and AI-driven automation in one seamless solution. TeamViewer ONE helps enterprises reduce complexity, proactively manage their IT environments, and empower employees with reliable, secure, and frictionless technology experiences.
   

  

 To strengthen this vision, we are looking for a dedicated Solutions Engineer who will help customers unlock the full potential of TeamViewer ONE. In this role, you will design and demonstrate solutions, showcase the platform’s value across different use cases, and support enterprises in adopting remote connectivity and digital workplace capabilities at scale.
   

  

 As a (Senior) Solution Engineer, you will be a key technical & business partner to the Nordics Sales Team for enterprise accounts, responsible for demonstrating the value of our software solutions to prospective and existing customers. You will collaborate closely with sales, product, and technical teams to deliver tailored solutions that address the unique challenges of our customers' IT environments.
   

  

* Technical Expertise & Demonstrations
* Become a subject matter expert on TeamViewer’s IT and DEX product portfolio.
* Deliver engaging product demonstrations, workshops, and webinars tailored to customer pain points.
* Articulate the technical and business value of our solutions to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Discovery & Solution Design
* Conduct detailed discovery sessions to understand customer challenges and objectives.
* Design and propose customized solutions that align with customer needs and leverage TeamViewer’s capabilities.
* Develop solution proposals, statements of work (SOWs), and technical documentation.
* Proof of Value (POV/POC) & Pilot Management
* Lead POV/POC and pilot engagements to validate solution effectiveness in customer environments.
* Provide hands-on technical guidance and support throughout the validation process.
* Analyze results and deliver actionable recommendations.
* Sales Enablement & Collaboration
* Partner with sales teams throughout the sales cycle, providing technical expertise and support.
* Respond to RFx documents with accurate and compelling technical responses.
* Collaborate with Product Management, Engineering, and Customer Success to ensure customer satisfaction and continuous improvement.
* Thought Leadership & Market Awareness
* Stay current on industry trends, competitive offerings, and emerging technologies.
* Provide feedback to internal teams to influence product roadmap and innovation.


**Requirements**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field (or equivalent experience).
* 5+ years in technical pre-sales, solutions engineering, or enterprise IT consulting.
* Deep understanding of enterprise IT environments, including endpoint management, remote connectivity, and DEX platforms.
* Experience with SaaS applications such as RMM, ITSM, Asset Management, and Observability tools.
* Hands-on experience with APIs, scripting, virtualization, cloud computing, and security protocols.
* Proven ability to engage with C-level stakeholders and translate complex technical concepts into business value.
* Strong presentation, communication, and documentation skills.
* Willingness to travel up to 30% of the time.
* Exceptional interpersonal skills – you excel at building trust and rapport with stakeholders at all levels, from IT professionals to C-level executives. You’re confident presenting complex solutions in a clear, compelling way.
* Strong technical acumen – you have deep knowledge of enterprise systems management, modern device management, and end-user computing. You understand the challenges of large, complex IT environments and can speak the language of enterprise IT fluently.
* Collaborative mindset with independent drive – you thrive both as a self-starter and as a team player. You know how to work effectively with sales professionals and cross-functional teams to achieve shared goals.
* Professional presence and attention to detail – you bring a polished, reliable approach to every customer interaction, ensuring high-quality outcomes and experiences.
* Excellent communication skills – your verbal, written, and presentation abilities are top-tier, enabling you to clearly convey technical concepts and business value to diverse audiences.


**What We Offer**
* Onsite Onboarding in our HQ office for an optimal start
* Great compensation and benefits packages including company achievement bonus or sales bonus, company stocks and regular salary reviews
* Premiums for the private pension plan up to the maximum amount are topped up by TeamViewer
* Special terms for local gyms
* Access to Corporate Benefits platform with many discounts
* Regular Team events and company-wide celebrations
* Open door policy, no dress code rules, frequent all Hands and Leadership Lunches
* We celebrate diversity as one of core values, join and drive one of the c-a-r-e initiatives together with us!


 TeamViewer is an equal opportunities employer and is committed to building an inclusive culture where everyone feels welcome and supported. We C-A-R-E and understand that our diverse, values-driven culture makes us stronger. As we continue to grow as a company, we also focus on enabling our employees to grow both personally and professionally. We are proud to have an open and embracing workplace environment that will empower you to be your best no matter your gender, civil or family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race.

title: Systemtekniker/Systemingenjör
description:
**Newsec erbjuder fastighetsägare, investerare och hyresgäster ett komplett utbud av tjänster inom tjänsteområdena Property Asset Management och Advisory.**
*Newsec grundades 1994 och är idag ett partnerägt företag med cirka 2 700 medarbetare fördelade över de sju nordiska och baltiska marknaderna. Newsec är Sveriges ledande fastighetsförvaltare. Vi har hög tillväxttakt och efterfrågan på våra tjänster ökar, vi rekryterar därför aktivt och behöver utöka vår verksamhet med* 
*en* 
*Systemtekniker/Systemingenjör – Mätning & Automation till Newsec Digital Solutions.
 *Välkommen med din ansökan!**
**Vill du arbeta med framtidens fastighetsteknik?**
 Vi söker dig som har 1–2 års erfarenhet som installationstekniker inom el eller automation och som vill ta nästa steg i en miljö där teknik, innovation och hållbarhet möts. Hos oss får du arbeta med energimätning, sensorteknik, tekniska nätverk och fastighetsautomation – i en roll där du får växa med uppgiften.
   

  

**Vad innebär rollen?**
 Som systemtekniker hos oss kommer du att:
   

  

* Installera och konfigurera tekniska system inom Mätning, automation och sensorteknik
* Arbeta med tekniska nätverk, bussystem och digitala styrsystem (OT/IT)
* Delta i driftsättning och felsökning av systemlösningar
* Samarbeta med projektledare, konsulter och kunder i olika projekt
* Dokumentera installationer och bidra till teknisk kvalitet i leveranser


**Vi söker dig som har:**
* 1–2 års erfarenhet inom elinstallation eller automation
* God förståelse för tekniska system, gärna inom fastighetsteknik
* Intresse för digitala lösningar, OT/IT och tekniska nätverk
* Förmåga att läsa ritningar och arbeta strukturerat
* B-körkort (meriterande)


**Om Digital Solutions**
 Inom
 **Digital Solutions** 
 arbetar vi med tekniska koncept inom:
   

  

* Fastighetsenergimätning
* Fastighetsautomation
* Sensorteknik
* Driftövervakning


 Vi är ofta ansvariga utförare i våra leveranser, men vi ser ett växande behov av kompetens i de tidiga skedena – projektering, konstruktion och inventering. Därför söker vi dig som vill vara med och stärka vår kapacitet i dessa delar.
   

  

**Ditt framtida team**
 Du blir en del av ett engagerat team med 12 kollegor inom en större koncern med 2800 medarbetare. Vi har en stark kultur av samarbete, innovation och utveckling. Vår affär finns idag hos 30 fastighetsbolag med cirka 200 installationer årligen – och vi har ambitiösa planer på att expandera till fler marknader internationellt.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig:**
* En utvecklande roll i ett framtidsområde
* Möjlighet att arbeta med ny teknik och smarta lösningar
* Kompetensutveckling och karriärmöjligheter inom koncernen
* Ett inkluderande team med hög teknisk kompetens


**Ansökan**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid med placering i Stockholm. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.
   

  

 För oss är det viktigt att all kompetens på arbetsmarknaden tillvaratas. Vi välkomnar alla sökande och eftersträvar mångfald.
   

  

*På grund av GDPR tar vi ej emot din ansökan via mejl. Alla ansökningar behandlas konfidentiellt.*
 Läs gärna mer om oss på vår hemsida www.newsec.se, där hittar du även våra andra lediga tjänster och har dessutom möjlighet att Connecta med oss.

title: Android software developer
description:
**Swedium Global** 

  is the growing System Engineering and Solution Company, offers services like Semiconductor Engineering R&D Services, Embedded Systems Development, Custom Application Software Development, Web and Cloud Application Development, Testing Services, Consultancy and Outsourcing services to our clients across the globe for an onsite and offshore business model. Swedium Global is having presence in Sweden, Finland, Poland, Czech Republic and in India.
 




  





**Swedium Global Services** 
  are looking for 
 **Android software developer** 
  for one of our Automotive Customer.
 



**Location:** 
 Gothenburg
 



**Period:** 
 2026-01-12 to 2026-07-31
 



**Minimum years of experience:** 
  8 Years
 



**Title: Android software developer** 




 As developer in one of our teams you’ll have the opportunity to work with the latest technology in an exciting and global environment. We team up with Google and other big players to deliver world class android applications and services to be the most desired and successful transport solution and infrastructure provider in the world.
 



  





 Our Android teams have an area of responsibility where you will design and build new features and applications ensuring performance, quality and productivity for our customers across our brands. Our teams are responsible for the entire SW life cycle so you will also be part of securing the deliveries in production.
 



 We welcome you in our open culture. We promise you a lot of opportunities to grow and learn. We’re a great team with competent and easy-to-talk to colleagues. If you have a passion for developing Android applications and services - this is your place!
 



  





**Wanted profile:** 




 We are looking for a passionate Android developer with proven experience in software development.
 



 You will fit well if you are a social, trustful and committed person who can explain complex technical aspects verbally and in documentation. You need to have the ability to drive change, have a passion for innovation and new technologies. Additionally, it is expected that you have a personal drive to reach the objectives and targets set for your team. Lastly, if you have a strong ability to inspire, develop and motivate individuals and teams – you are our perfect match.
 



  





**Requirements & Qualifications** 




 • Bachelor or master’s in computer science, Software Engineering, Electronics or equivalent.
 



 • Minimum 8 years of experience from software development and good understanding of Java/Kotlin and commonly used Android design patterns.
 



 • Knowledge in working in a software development environment using tools such as Git, Jenkins, Jira, Artifactory.
 



 • Experience using techniques for quality assuring software such as unit testing and integration testing using relevant tools e.g. Espresso, Junit
 



 • Experience in Radio and Media application development

title: Cybersecurity Consultant
description:
**Come work with us** 




 Netlight strives to be a truly diverse, equitable and inclusive organization. Regardless of who you are, what personality, background, and experience you have, you enrich our culture through your values. Netlight’s purpose is to unleash full potential, realize great careers, and fulfill personal growth. To achieve this, we have a highly engaged network organization, where every employee gets a mentor, delivery coach and personal communities. The key to our continued success is trust and personal responsibility, diverse experiences, challenging opportunities and developing from personal values. Every Netlighter is an active part of building and shaping this culture, which leads to a clear correlation between personal growth and the growth of Netlight.
 



  





**About us** 




 Netlight provides a full range of premium IT-consulting services at the forefront of the digital industry and stands out for its product- and technology-independent expertise in a wide range of industries and clients. We are a network organization of more than 2 000 role models making aspiring digital leaders successful in their business-critical IT projects. Netlight has been awarded several times as top employer, as well as for growth, continued profitability and engagement for diversity, equity and equality within the IT industry. Today we are growing all across Europe, currently with more than 13 active international offices.
 



  





**What does it mean to be a Cybersecurity Consultant at Netlight?** 




 It will vary a lot between Netlighters as we, around the right person, will design a role together with you. You will be starting somewhere familiar with your experience, and from there it is your call how your career at Netlight will look, ranging from which clients you will work with, what role you want to take (based on your personal experience, strengths, your personal interest) and how your relationship with your mentor/coach/EDGE networks/social networks will look like.
 



  





 You will build the products, systems and technical solutions of today and tomorrow. This means that our consultants get the opportunity to help build and scale existing and new products and companies and also continuously learn and master a variety of technical tools. At Netlight, we will challenge you. Our clients will challenge you. You will challenge our clients. You will challenge us. We will grow together and unleash the potential in each other.
 



  





 Specifically as a Cybersecurity Consultant, you will collaborate with other Netlighters and clients in Stockholm and across offices. It can be working as Security Engineer, Information Security Engineer, Security Architect, Security Analyst, Solution Engineering, Site Reliability Engineer, DevSecOps Engineer, Security Lead, Security Manager, Security Officer, Secure Cloud Architect, it can be working in a backend role building a secure system, it can be working as part of a security advisory team, Project Manager of building a secure system, or being part of a Technical Due Diligence project bringing the security perspectives, to give some examples. In parallel to this, you will be an important part of improving our Cybersecurity work and being an important part of our passionate Cybersecurity community at Netlight.
 



  





**Minimum Qualifications** 



* Master Degree in Engineering or Technology
* Verbal and written fluency in English is required, and meriting with Swedish/Danish/Norwegian
* 0,5-5 years of work experience with Cybersecurity, Information Security or building secure systems
* International mindset, as you will collaborate with Netlighters and clients across offices.



  





**Application** 




 We are always looking for new Netlighters, so feel free to apply if you meet the qualifications. We try to get in touch within two weeks
 
 if
 
 we find that your profile and experiences are a match beyond the qualifications at this time.

title: Engineering Manager
description:
Vi söker efter en senior Engineering Manager med minst fem års dokumenterad ledarerfarenhet inom IT, produktutveckling eller tekniska team.
   

  

 Konsulten kommer att ansvara för ett dussintal utvecklare fördelade på två agila team. Samtliga som rapporterar till rollen är ingenjörer med Stockholmskontoret som bas. Rollen kräver inte djup teknisk kompetens, men en solid förståelse för modern mjukvaruutveckling, arbetssätt (WoW) och relevanta begrepp är ett krav.
   

  

 Det är mycket viktigt att personen trivs i en kontorsmiljö, då närvaron på kontoret är betydligt högre än arbete på distans. Vi söker en trygg och erfaren ledare som är bekväm med att hålla olika typer av personalsamtal och som hanterar en miljö med många parallella uppgifter på ett stabilt och professionellt sätt. Kunden kommer genomgå ganska omfattande förändringar nästa år vilket sannolikt kräver förändringsledning.
   

  

**GRUNDKRAV**
* Flytande svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift
* 3 fasta dagar i veckan på kontoret, vissa veckor fler dagar
* Erfarenhet av agil miljö
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet inom tech-ledning med personalansvar
* Vana vid att leda agil produktteam (hela användarflödet, ej komponentteam)
* Stark förmåga att arbeta med stakeholders och skapa samsyn mellan affär, teknik och design
* Grundläggande erfarenhet av målstyrning, gärna enligt OKR
* Erfarenhet av rekrytering av ingenjörer
* Förmåga att vid behov facilitera agila ceremonier


**MERITERANDE**
* Gedigen erfarenhet av datadriven produktutveckling och A/B-testning
* Erfarenhet av Figma, Miro, Atlassian, GitHub
* Erfarenhet av anammande av GenAI-verktyg
* Erfarenhet från fintech eller bank
* Erfarenhet av förändringsledning
* Erfarenhet av att skala organisationer eller bygga upp nya produktområden


**Start: Januari till Oktober**
 Plats: Stockholm Centralt, (Tisdagar, onsdagar och torsdagar är obligatoriska kontorsdagar)
   

  

 Rollen kräver full professionell behärskning av svenska och engelska

title: Head Of Assembly and Testing - Wave Energy
description:
Working at CorPower Ocean you will be part of a world class team, determined to make big impact. We are on a mission to Power the Planet with clean electricity from ocean waves. We offer autonomy and flexibility, combined with personal responsibility. CorPower Ocean is a global leader in wave energy, with a technology that has shown game-changing performance. Your work will contribute to the global energy transition by unlocking one of the largest untapped sources of clean energy on earth. Since the start in 2012 CorPower has raised more than 115mEUR to our wave energy technology to market, supporting a growing commercial project pipeline.
 



**The Role** 




 As Head of Assembly & Testing (A&T), you will lead assembly, testing and maintenance activities, across our CorPack wave cluster products including Wave Energy Converters (WECs), mooring, anchoring and collection hub solutions. Your team ensures our products are assembled, tested and maintained on schedule, meeting functionality, reliability and performance requirements.
 



 The A&T team develops and documents procedures for next-generation products, delivering verified methods, tools and protocols that can be replicated by Operations & Maintenance (O&M) teams worldwide. Assembly and dry-testing of Power-Take Off (PTO) systems in Sweden as well as assembly, operations and maintenance of our demonstration farm off the coast in northern Portugal are part of the scope, where new tools and methods are tested and qualified for commercial use.
 



 This role combines hands-on technical leadership, people leadership and program management across our sites. Travel between sites is required. You will work closely with Engineering, Supply Chain & Quality and Marine Operations teams to deliver new product programs.
 



**Responsibilities** 




 Technology & Product Leadership
 


* Hands-on technical leadership for Assembly, Testing and Operations, actively guiding the technical solutions being implemented.
* Program management to ensure products are assembled and tested on time, meeting functional, reliability, performance, and cost targets.
* Ensure compliance with industry, safety and environmental standards, always maintaining human safety as the top priority in all operations and development efforts.
* Guide product design to meet manufacturing, assembly and service requirements.
* Feedback insight from assembly, testing and operations to engineering teams to continuously improve product design and component selection.
* Ensure technology and operational decisions support scalability, manufacturability and industrialization.
* Interact with customers and stakeholders. Represent the company in dialogues related to Assembly, Testing and O&M methods.
* Select and implement digital tools, methods, and processes to enhance efficiency and quality.
* Ensure the organization's technology infrastructure supports its needs.
* Manage budgets and propose investments to the Management Team as needed.



 People and Project Leadership
 


* People leadership across the A&T team, with engineers and technicians covering Assembly, Testing, Analysis, Operations, and Documentation functions.
* Plan and execute all Assembly & Test activities to meet schedule, cost and performance goals.
* Lead A&T team members across Product teams covering Wave Energy Converters and Collection hubs. Prioritize and supervise activities and deliverables.
* Support new product development projects from specification and planning through design, fabrication, assembly, installation, testing and certification.
* Ensure alignment across all stakeholders by maintaining clear communication, schedule updates and project reports.
* Lead, mentor, and inspire the team to create a culture of collaboration, , innovation, and continuous improvement towards business goals.
* Develop and execute a talent strategy to attract, retain, and grow top talent.
* Develop a work environment that supports each team member in reaching their full potential. Manage, support and evaluate engineers’ performance.



**Skills and requirements** 



* Minimum of 10 years of experience leading assembly, integration and/or test teams developing advanced systems or equipment in industries relevant to ocean energy.
* Proven track record of developing new products through the full cycle – from specification and design through assembly testing and deployment, resulting in successful market introduction.
* Experience working in harsh environments such as offshore, mining, or other challenging industrial sectors with high reliability requirements is a plus.
* Experience in fast-paced companies is advantageous.
* Extraordinary energy and strong people leadership skills with a passion for coaching and developing teams to reach their full potential.
* Determination and stamina to lead projects through to completion, bringing confidence to teams that ambitious goals can be met, even under pressure.
* Skilled in modern tools for assembly, test and data analysis, with the ability to identify and implement efficient engineering systems and infrastructure.
* Proficient in English, both spoken and written. In addition, Swedish is desirable but not essential.
* Above all, we value your personality, drive and passion for advancing renewable energy technologies.



**As a person, you:** 



* are striving for excellence, put quality into everything you do
* are self-motivated and constantly seek the most efficient ways to work
* search for simple and sustainable solutions to difficult problems
* love to learn new things, and take pride in constantly developing your skills
* are persistent, knowing it takes stamina to reach pioneering goals
* see your tasks through to completion
* are comfortable in presenting your solutions internally and externally
* are data driven and strive to always back your points with solid analysis



 CorPower Ocean has a diverse team with many nationalities and backgrounds, all working towards the same goal: To Powe the Planet with clean energy from ocean waves.

title: Product Manager
description:
**Filed is building the first AI tax preparer trusted by America’s accounting firms.**
 This industry might seem boring,but it’s a $70B backbone of the economy that’s breaking under a talent shortage no one has solved. We’re fixing it. Fast.
   

  

 In just 9 months, we’ve hit strong product-market fit, are generating insanely fast-growing, ridiculously sticky revenue, and are backed by top-tier investors. We’re not a tool—we’re the missing workforce firms have been sounding the alarm for. We’re building the future by expanding our already 30-person team with those who want to say “I was there when it all started.”
   

  

 Read more → TechCrunch
   

  

 ⸻
   

  

**What We Should Tell You About The Role**
 You’ll be the owner of how our product comes to life. From funnel optimization to roadmap decisions, you’ll connect the dots between user insights, product data, and execution. You’ll work closely with our CTO and engineering leads to turn ideas into seamless, conversion-driving experiences that define how accounting firms interact with AI.
   

  

 This isn’t a “write tickets and make slide decks” role. It’s hands-on product ownership in a company that moves fast, builds deeply technical products, and cares obsessively about solving real customer pain.
   

  

 Here’s why this is a terrible job
   

  

 You’ll be thrown into an environment where clarity is earned, not handed to you. The roadmap changes as fast as the market does. You’ll constantly balance engineering capacity, customer urgency, and product vision. You’ll be expected to think in systems, not in silos, and to understand the details behind every metric that moves.
   

  

 If you prefer predictable structure, neat processes, and plenty of time to think before acting, you’ll hate it here. This is not a 9-5 job.
   

  

* and why it’s the best career choice you’ll make


 You’ll help shape a product that’s redefining an entire profession. You’ll work alongside a team that ships, iterates, and scales at startup speed while holding the quality bar sky-high. You’ll see the direct impact of your decisions every week—in customer adoption, in revenue growth, and in how the industry talks about us.
   

  

 If you’ve ever wanted to own the full product loop—insight, build, measure, repeat—this is your playground.
   

  

 The teammate we’re looking for
   

  

* Thinks in systems and outcomes, not just features
* Can translate complex technical work into clear, actionable priorities
* Comfortable making calls with incomplete information
* Deeply curious about users and motivated by real-world feedback
* Calm under pressure, clear under chaos, and great at getting to the “why” behind the “what”
* Has experience in product management for SaaS, AI, or B2B software


 What you’ll be responsible for
   

  

* Owning the full product funnel, identifying opportunities to increase conversion and retention
* Driving key parts of the product roadmap in collaboration with the CTO and engineering leads
* Acting as the glue between engineering teams to ensure smooth, integrated delivery
* Partnering with customers and internal teams to gather, analyze, and share insights that guide product decisions
* Tracking product performance metrics and iterating fast based on what you learn


**The Process**
* Introduction call (30 minutes)
* Skill discovery call (60 minutes)
* Final round (60 minutes)


**Equal Opportunity**
 Filed is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. If you’re excited about this role but don’t meet every single qualification, we encourage you to apply anyway as we’re building a team of people with diverse strengths, experiences, and backgrounds.
   

  

 Compensation Range: SEK 60K - SEK 70K

title: Tech Agent Program
description:
Idag är klivet in i IT-branschen alldeles för stort – det vill vi ändra på! Tech Agent Programmet är utformat för dig som vill arbeta inom IT efter att ha arbetat några år inom andra områden. Det är helt enkelt en intensiv 4-veckorsutbildning för dig som vill satsa på en ny karriär. Om du har viljan och siktet inställt på IT-branschen, vill vi vara din karriärpartner som hjälper dig att förverkliga dina drömmar.
   

  

 Om programmet
   

  

 Tech Agent Program drivs i samarbete med Lexicon IT-proffs, ett ledande utbildningsföretag. Utbildningen pågår under 4 veckor på plats i Lexicons lokaler och vårt kontor. Den varvas med teori, labbar och självstudier. Wise IT bekostar utbildningen.
   

  

 Läs om kursinnehållet här: Tech Agent Program | Wise IT
   

  

 Vad händer efter utbildningen?
   

  

 Vi garanterar alla som tar examen en anställning som tar vid när programmet är slut. Placeringen för anställningen kommer primärt vara i Stockholm. Utbildningen är intensiv, så du bör inte vara rädd för att ta dig an en utmaning när du söker.
   

  

 Vem kan söka till Tech Agent Program?
   

  

 Vi tror att du har:
   

  

* Några års arbetslivserfarenhet, varav minst 1 års service erfarenhet.
* Obehindrat språkbruk i både svenska och engelska, både i skrift och tal.
* Intresse i teknik för att kunna tillgodogöra dig kursinnehållet på bästa sätt.
* Möjlighet att vara på plats i Stockholm under utbildningstiden (4 veckor, mån-fre kl: 8-17).


 Meriterande är om du:
   

  

* Har arbetat med kundtjänst.
* Har telefonvana.
* Har gått IT-gymnasiet eller har en annan koppling till IT


 För att du ska trivas i rollen ser vi att du har ett genuint IT-intresse. Som person är du driven, lojal och lösnings orienterad. Du motiveras av tanken att jobba som konsult, lära dig mycket på kort tid och ha ett mål att utvecklas inom IT.
   

  

 Villkor
   

  

 Vi på Wise IT vill underlätta för fler människor att öppna upp sina ögon för en karriär inom IT, och därför står vi för hela utbildningskostnaden. Det enda vi begär av dig är full närvaro och engagemang i programmet. Vi garanterar även en anställning som konsult hos oss när du är klar med utbildningen, under förutsättning att du blir godkänd och får ditt examensbevis.
   

  

 Ansökan
   

  

 Inkludera ett CV och en kort motivering i din ansökan om varför du vill delta i vårt Tech Agent Program och vad som lockar dig till denna möjlighet.
   

  

 Har du frågor eller funderingar får du gärna höra av dig till Anne Eklöf (anne.eklöf@wiseit.se). Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mail då vi värnar om din personliga integritet. Du kan läsa mer om hur vi behandlar personuppgifter enligt GDPR i Wise Group-koncernens policy för behandling av personuppgifter.
   

  

 Nästa omgång startar i januari 2026, och vi kommer att arbeta med urvalet under november och december. Därför kan svar dröja något längre än vanligt. Vi tackar för ditt tålamod.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan! 🌻
   

  

*"Om man inte har jobbat inom IT tidigare och känner ett intresse, så är det en jättebra ingång. Det är en kort utbildning med garanterat jobb. Det är en bra möjlighet att få testa på branschen om man tycker att det verkar roligt." – Axel Lind, tidigare Tech Agent som idag är inne på sitt andra uppdrag via Wise IT. Läs hela intervjun här: Axel bytte karriär på fyra veckor | Wise IT*

title: Enterprise Solutions Architect
description:
**Description**
 Are you passionate about cloud technology and helping customers innovate?
   

  

 Join our AWS Solutions Architecture team in Stockholm and empower enterprises across industries to innovate at speed and scale with cloud technologies.
   

  

 As a Solutions Architect at AWS, you’ll build technical relationships with customers of all sizes and operate as their trusted advisor, ensuring they get the most out of the cloud at every stage of their journey.
   

  

 You’ll manage the overall technical relationship between AWS and our customers, making recommendations on security, cost, performance, reliability and operational efficiency to accelerate their challenging, mission-critical projects.
   

  

 Internally, you will be the voice of the customer, sharing their needs and wants to inform the roadmap of AWS features.
   

  

 In this role, your creativity will link technology to tangible solutions, with the opportunity to define cloud-native reference architectures for a variety of use cases.
   

  

 You will participate in the creation and sharing of best practices, technical content and new reference architectures (e.g. white papers, code samples, blog posts) and evangelize and educate about AWS technology (e.g. through workshops, user groups, meetups, public speaking, online videos or conferences).
   

  

 This role is within the Europe North organization (Sweden) and you would be working with Enterprise customers.
   

  

 If you can educate AWS customers about the art of the possible, while challenging the impossible... come build the future with us!
   

  

 AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector.
   

  

 A day in the life
   

  

 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Background in any of the following: Cloud Architecture, Systems Design, Software Development, Infrastructure Architecture, Data Engineering or DevOps
* Technical Degree (Computer Science, Maths, Engineering or equivalent) and/or relevant tech experience.
* Fluent written and verbal communication skills in English
* A passion for technology and for learning
* 
* Background in any of the following: Cloud Architecture, Systems Design, Software Development, Infrastructure Architecture, Data Engineering or DevOps
* Technical Degree (Computer Science, Maths, Engineering or equivalent) and/or relevant tech experience.
* Fluent written and verbal communication skills in English
* A passion for technology and for learning


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience designing, building, refactoring or operating large scale and impactful IT systems - either on premises or in the cloud
* Working knowledge of cloud native architectures
* Knowledge of a modern programming language (Python, JavaScript, Go, .Net, Java, etc.) and/or scripting, Infrastructure as Code etc.
* In-depth working knowledge in a technology domain such as distributed internet-scale web or mobile applications, DevOps, Serverless, Big Data, Analytics, Machine Learning, enterprise workloads (SAP, VMware, Windows etc.), high-performance databases (SQL and/or NoSQL), complex networking implementations, highly secured workloads etc.
* Experience working in a customer-facing role or a role which involved public speaking
* AWS certification (e.g. AWS Solutions Architect Associate or Professional) or other industry certification
* Fluent written and verbal communication skills in Swedish


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)

title: Recruitment Coordinator
description:
**TL;DR** 
 - We’re looking for a Recruitment Coordinator to support Lovable’s intentional growth. You will collaborate with recruiters and hiring managers to create engaging job descriptions, make sure our ATS (Ashby) is flawless, enhance candidate experience, conduct screenings, coordinate interview logistics, ensuring a smooth experience for our
 **lovable candidates** 
 .
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
 Lovable lets anyone and everyone build software with plain English. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the digital world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, automate work, and bring their ideas to life. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value extreme ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek out people who care deeply, ship fast, and are eager to make a dent in the world.
   

  

**What We're Looking For**
* 2+ years experience in a similar role, ideally in a global startup or fast-moving tech environment.
* Strong communicator with exceptional writing skills, capable of facilitating clear communication both internally and, most importantly, with our candidates.
* Self-organized, proactive and excellent at keeping multiple workstreams on track.
* Growth-oriented and comfortable adapting to change in an evolving environment.
* Passionate user of Lovable.


**What You’ll Do**
* Develop and maintain detailed job descriptions and specifications in collaboration with hiring managers to attract the right talent.
* Utilize our ATS effectively to track candidate progress, maintain accurate records, and generate reports on recruitment metrics.
* Conduct thorough candidate screenings to assess qualifications and cultural fit, ensuring only the most suitable candidates move forward.
* Coordinate interview logistics, including scheduling interviews, preparing interview materials, and communicating with candidates to confirm details, demonstrating exceptional organizational skills.
* Ensure compliance with employment laws and regulations, maintaining confidentiality and ethical standards throughout the recruitment process.
* Provide a positive candidate experience by maintaining clear communication, offering feedback, and ensuring timely follow-ups.


**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English. It’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join.
* We treat all candidates equally - if you’re interested please apply through our careers portal.

title: Customer Success Manager, Core Clouds - Public Sector
description:
*To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.*
 Job Category
   

  

 Customer Success
   

  

 Job Details
   

  

**About Salesforce**
 Salesforce is the #1 AI CRM, where humans with agents drive customer success together. Here, ambition meets action. Tech meets trust. And innovation isn’t a buzzword — it’s a way of life. The world of work as we know it is changing and we're looking for Trailblazers who are passionate about bettering business and the world through AI, driving innovation, and keeping Salesforce's core values at the heart of it all.
   

  

 Ready to level-up your career at the company leading workforce transformation in the agentic era? You’re in the right place! Agentforce is the future of AI, and you are the future of Salesforce.
   

  

 At Salesforce, customers who choose our Signature Success Plan unlock our most elite level of partnership — expert guidance, deep product knowledge, and proactive support to stay agile and maximise value. As a Customer Success Manager (CSM) for Signature Success, you will become a strategic partner to our most important customers, serving as their trusted advisor and orchestrating the full Signature experience.
   

  

**Role Description**
 You will set the customer up for success through optimisation of the solution, with special care during critically important peak events. This will require some technical knowledge of Salesforce Clouds but most importantly, the ability to align internal and external stakeholders and orchestrate the right resources to provide a tailored, unified Signature experience.
   

  

 As a Customer Success Manager, you will be a named advisor to a portfolio of Signature Success customers in the Public Sector. You will build deep, trusted relationships with customer stakeholders and Salesforce account teams, maintaining a high level of awareness of customer priorities, business goals, and potential risks.
   

  

 You will guide your customers to success by aligning their business goals with the Salesforce platform, offering strategic recommendations, coordinating Signature Success deliverables, and ensuring operational excellence during critical events. You will also lead communication during major incidents, providing timely updates and managing customer expectations.
   

  

**Your Impact**
*Strategic Partnership*
* Act as the trusted point of contact and advocate for your customers, driving alignment between their business goals and Salesforce’s capabilities.
* Build and sustain relationships with customer IT and business executives, becoming a true strategic partner.


*Customer Enablement*
* Guide customers in adopting the Salesforce platform through proactive recommendations and personalised service delivery from the Signature catalogue.
* Provide insight into new features and releases, helping customers navigate change and mitigate potential risks.


*Incident Management*
* Lead communications during high-severity incidents, ensuring a smooth and transparent experience while advocating for customer resolution.


*Renewal & Growth*
* Clearly articulate and demonstrate the value of Signature Success to ensure ongoing investment and expansion.


**Minimum Requirements**
* 7+ years of experience in Cloud environments in roles such as Customer Success, SaaS platform management, Solution Architecture, or Technical Consulting.
* Outstanding communication and presentation skills with demonstrated ability to communicate and influence optimally at all levels of the organisation, including executive and C-level.
* Skills for analysing technical concepts, translating them into business terms and mapping business requirements into technical features.
* Ability to explain technical concepts in business-friendly terms to customers, then explain customer needs to internal partners.
* Experience leading efforts of cross-functional teams to facilitate the resolution or disposition of customer needs or projects.
* Proven ability to build trust-based relationships and navigate complex, enterprise-level environments


**Preferred Requirements**
* Experience with the Salesforce Core platform is a plus.
* Salesforce product certifications are a plus.
* Knowledge of Salesforce products and features, capabilities, best use, and how to deploy.
* Experience working with Enterprise-level customers.


 Unleash Your Potential
   

  

 When you join Salesforce, you’ll be limitless in all areas of your life. Our benefits and resources support you to find balance and
 *be your best* 
 , and our AI agents accelerate your impact so you can
 *do your best* 
 . Together, we’ll bring the power of Agentforce to organizations of all sizes and deliver amazing experiences that customers love. Apply today to not only shape the future — but to redefine what’s possible — for yourself, for AI, and the world.
   

  

 Accommodations
   

  

 If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.
   

  

 Posting Statement
   

  

 Salesforce is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a policy of non-discrimination with all employees and applicants for employment. What does that mean exactly? It means that at Salesforce, we believe in equality for all. And we believe we can lead the path to equality in part by creating a workplace that’s inclusive, and free from discrimination. Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. Any employee or potential employee will be assessed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications – without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, transgender status, age, disability, veteran or marital status, political viewpoint, or other classifications protected by law. This policy applies to current and prospective employees, no matter where they are in their Salesforce employment journey. It also applies to recruiting, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, assessment of job performance, discipline, termination, and everything in between. Recruiting, hiring, and promotion decisions at Salesforce are fair and based on merit. The same goes for compensation, benefits, promotions, transfers, reduction in workforce, recall, training, and education.

title: Information Governance Lead
description:
*Vill du vara med och forma framtidens informationshantering inom en av Sveriges ledande försäkringsaktörer? Som Informationsstyrningsansvarig SAK får du en central och strategisk roll där du driver viktiga initiativ och skapar affärsvärde ur information. Här får du möjligheten att leda, påverka och utveckla arbetet med informationsstyrning i en komplex och spännande miljö.*
**Om jobbet**
 I rollen som Informationsstyrningsansvarig SAK ansvarar du för att driva och samordna informationsstyrningsinitiativ inom affärsenheten SAK. Du fungerar som en central kontaktpunkt och möjliggörare för enhetlig och hållbar informationshantering, samt samarbetar nära både verksamhets- och IT-ledare. Med din förståelse för affärens behov engagerar och stöttar du organisationen i att utveckla och implementera effektiva arbetssätt för informationsstyrning.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer vara bland annat:
   

  

* Löpande stötta och engagera verksamheten i deras arbete med informationsstyrning
* Utveckla arbetssätt för informationsarkitektur och stödja utrullningen av dessa
* Följa upp och rapportera till SAK Styrgrupp Informationsstyrning om aktiviteter och effektivitet
* Utforma och genomföra utbildningsinsatser inom informationsarkitektur
* Administrera processer, rutiner, policys och verktyg för informationsstyrning
* Granska och godkänna leveranser från arbetsgrupper inom området
