* Är van vid agila projekt och vill bidra till att utveckla vårt arbetssätt


 Vårt team
   

  

 Hos oss blir du en del av ett engagerat och prestigelöst team med djup teknisk kompetens inom Dynamics 365 Finance & Supply Chain management. Vi är en härlig blandning av arkitekter, utvecklare, applikation- och processpecialister som delar en passion för att digitalisera och optimera våra kunders verksamheter med hjälp av ny teknik från Microsoft.
   

  

 Att arbeta i team är centralt för oss på Accigo. Vi värdesätter mångfalden av perspektiv och erfarenheter som våra kollegor bidrar med – det är genom samarbete som vi skapar hållbara, innovativa och effektiva lösningar för våra kunder. Tillsammans kombinerar vi teknisk kompetens med verksamhetsförståelse och arbetar tätt med kollegor från andra affärsområden för att säkerställa framgångsrika projekt och långsiktiga relationer.
   

  

 Kompensation och förmåner
   

  

 Vår förmånspolicy är utvecklad för att möta både dina professionella och personliga behov. I vårt omfattande förmånspaket ingår friskvårdsbidrag, tjänstepension och frivillig sjukvårdsförsäkring. Vår ersättningsmodell består av en konkurrenskraftig fast del och en rörlig del som ger dig möjlighet att påverka din lön baserat på din prestation och ambition. Vi erbjuder både professionell och personlig utveckling.
   

  

**Nyfiken?** 
 Hör av dig till oss – vi tar gärna en kaffe och berättar mer: amir.hosseini@accigo.se
   

  

 Accigo är ett nordiskt konsultbolag som hjälper företag och organisationer med digital affärs- och verksamhetsutveckling med tekniken som möjliggörare. För oss handlar digitalisering till 90% om människor och 10% om teknik. Det är när samspelet mellan människa och teknik fungerar som digitaliseringens fulla styrka visar sig.
   

  

 För många handlar digitalisering mest om teknik. För oss är det så otroligt mycket större. Digitalisering kan få både människor och organisationer att våga sikta högre, följa sina drömmar och öppna dörrar som de inte ens visste fanns. Och när man ser igenom tekniken och börjar skönja vilka möjligheter som gömmer sig där bakom. Då ser man att framtiden kan vara en fantastisk plats – fylld av mänsklig energi och värme – och digitalisering är inget annat än vår superkraft för att komma dit.

title: Senior Software Engineer - C++
description:
Frostbite is EA's proprietary game engine. Its versatile tools and cutting-edge technology power creation on some of the world's most iconic and visually stunning games, including titles from EA SPORTS and Battlefield. Frostbite provides a unified platform that empowers developers to create hyper-realistic worlds, intricate gameplay, and lifelike animations with unmatched speed and quality. By joining Frostbite, you'll be at the forefront of game engine innovation, collaborating with top-tier developers to push the boundaries of interactive realism and immersive gameplay. Shape the future of gaming technology and leave your mark on the next generation of games.
 



  





 You will work on systems for data management and game asset processing, improving our content creator workflows and allowing faster iteration times. Some examples of the systems that you might work with:
 



  




* The system that provides on-disk data to our editor
* The pipeline for creating game-ready data
* A caching system for built data
* A service for On-demand loading



  





 This is a hybrid work model and you will be expecated to work in our Stockholm office 3 days per week and you will report to a Development Director.
 



  





**Responsibilities:** 



* You will provide architectural guidance and technical expertise to enhance performance, profiling, and optimization
* You will partner with the wider Frostbite engineering team to define strategic direction
* You will collaborate on design, testing, and maintenance efforts
* You will enhance tools, processes, and best practices
* You will work with leadership to develop roadmaps
* You will communicate with game and Frostbite teams to understand their needs and support them in using our technologies
* You will acquire and share domain expertise



  





**Qualifications:** 



* 7+ years of experience with C++ programming, data-guided design, and software architecture
* Experienced in building high-performing concurrent software
* Comfortable working within an established codebase
* Experience with Agile development practices
* Experience of data processing and data management
* Experience implementing databases or file systems
* Some experience with web services running locally and in Azure
* Some experience with content pipelines

title: System Engineer – High Voltage Automotive
description:
ALTEN is looking for a System Engineer to one of our major automotive clients in Gothenburg. In this role, you will be responsible for charging functionality development and design on vehicle level within the 600V electrical domain.

**About the role**


You will be part of a skilled and collaborative team of engineers working across system, wiring, packaging, and electrical architecture for electric vehicles.


Your main responsibility will be to develop, integrate, and optimize the vehicle’s charging functionality — ensuring reliable, safe, and efficient energy transfer between the vehicle and the charging infrastructure.


You will work cross-functionally with software, electrical, and hardware engineers to define system topology, communication interfaces, and integration strategies for the 600V system. The role requires solid understanding of ECU communication, system engineering principles, and vehicle electrical architecture.



**Your profile**


You are a structured and solution-oriented engineer with a genuine passion for vehicle electrification and system development. You thrive in a collaborative and innovative environment, where technology and teamwork go hand in hand.


We believe you have:  

* B.Sc. or M.Sc. in Electrical Engineering, Mechatronics, or a similar field.
* Experience working with high-voltage systems (600V) in automotive applications.
* Strong knowledge of electrical topology, architecture, and ECU communication (CAN, LIN, or Ethernet).
* Ability to interpret and translate system requirements into robust technical solutions.
* Fluent in English, both spoken and written. Swedish is an advantage.
**About ALTEN**


ALTEN is one of Europe’s largest engineering and IT consulting companies, with more than 57,000 employees across 30 countries.  

Our engineers lead complex and high-tech projects throughout the product development cycle for leading companies in industries such as Automotive, Aerospace, Energy, and Life Sciences.


In Sweden, we are about 1,300 committed employees located in 9 cities – from Lund in the south to Skellefteå in the north. For the fifth consecutive year, ALTEN has been recognized as one of Sweden’s most attractive employers by Karriärföretagen, thanks to our strong focus on career development, innovation, and technical excellence.


Visit www.alten.se to learn more about us.


  
Jobb detaljer
13/11/2025
Göteborg
Rekrytering Kontakt
ALTEN Sweden
recruitment@alten.se

title: Senior Computer Vision Engineer
description:
**We are looking for a Senior Computer Vision Engineer. The role involves developing and improving automated evaluation systems for AI and video analytics applications.**


### **Requirements**


* Knowledge of distributed computing environments to support scalable and high-performance execution.
* Practical experience in building and maintaining large-scale video datasets, establishing clear annotation standards, and working with labeling platforms like CVAT.
* Strong command of Python, with a focus on writing clean, efficient, and well-structured code following best software design principles.
* Skilled in interpreting model evaluation data and turning it into meaningful visual reports and performance dashboards.
* Solid background in applying test-driven methodologies and developing robust automation frameworks for advanced software environments.
* Deep understanding of assessing AI and video analysis models, including practical experience working with evaluation metrics such as precision, recall, confusion matrices, and error analysis.

title: Document Control Specialist
description:
**Job Overview:**

The Document Control Specialist applies their conceptual knowledge of Document Control and, with a moderate level of guidance and direction from colleagues and leadership, is responsible for solving a range of straightforward Document Control problems. They will be responsible for analyzing possible solutions using standard procedures and building knowledge of the company, processes, and customers. The Document Control Specialist understands key business drivers and applies this knowledge to solve problems in straightforward situations by analyzing possible solutions using technical experience, judgment, and precedents.


  
Our ingenuity fuels daily life. Together, we’ve forged some of the most trusted partnerships across the energy value chain to make what was once just an idea a reality: laying subsea infrastructure thousands of feet below sea level, installing platforms hundreds of miles from shore, using our expertise to design and build offshore wind infrastructure, and reshaping the onshore landscape to deliver the energy products the world needs safely and sustainably.
  

  

For more than 100 years, we've been making the impossible possible. Today, we're driving the energy transition with more than 30,000 of the brightest minds across 54 countries.
  
**Key Tasks and Responsibilities:**

* Assist the Lead Document Management lead in completing the day-to-day project activities
* Gain experience in the following work area: iDocs
* Develop basic technical skills to complete assigned work
* Become familiar with technical aspects of the Contract and Project Team Requirements pertaining to Document Management and project delivery requirements (standards, procedures, EDMS, formats, etc.)
* Facilitate and expedite the timely flow of technical information amongst project team members and external parties, such as the Client and Suppliers, via the EDMS
* Accurately track, log, and distribute releases of both internal and external documentation, including related metadata
* Provide input in preparing Document Management status reports
* Assist in the establishment, maintenance, development, and improvement of Document Management processes, systems, and tools
* Participate in internal and external audits as required
* Ensure active and frequent engagement with MOPEX counterpart/s for the project
* Deliver information required for handover and turnover in accordance with project contractual requirements
* Archive project records

Reports to:
  

Project: Lead Document Management
  

Functional: Department Manager
  

Liaise With: Lead Document Management, Project Engineer, Project Manager, Department Manager


  
**Essential Qualifications and Education:**

* Professional Degree / Post Graduate Degree/Bachelor’s Degree
* 3-8 years of experience in Document Management with a major contractor or consultant
* Good knowledge of Electronic Database Management System (EDMS) software, MS Office, and Adobe
* Computer literate in Microsoft programs: Word, Access, PowerPoint, Excel, Project
* Working knowledge of industry-utilized EDMS tools
* Have wide experience with technical activities, including onshore and offshore operations
* Some functional, business, and industry expertise
* Ability to work as a team member
* Excellent organizational and time management skills
* Detail-oriented, dependable, and willing to handle multiple priorities

title: Simulation Engineer - Drive Innovation in Industrial Production
description:
**Simulation Engineer - Drive Innovation in Industrial Production**
===================================================================

Functional area: Research and Development
Location: Sweden
City: Stockholm
Company name: Atlas Copco Industrial Technique AB
Date of posting: Nov 13, 2025  

Being a Simulation Engineer in the Driveline team means working at the forefront of innovation and technology. You are part of a team dedicated to developing cutting-edge solutions for industry and committed to pushing the boundaries of what is possible. By leveraging the latest industry trends and technological advancements, we create sustainable and efficient driveline systems.



In this role, you contribute to exciting projects that shape the future of industrial production. You collaborate with experts in the field, using advanced simulation tools and techniques to optimize products and processes.  

  

Our vision is to be First in Mind—First in Choice, and we believe our success is driven by the passion and expertise of our team members.

  

**Your Role**



You participate in projects from concept to finished product, focusing on quality and efficiency.

  



Key responsibilities include:


* Performing advanced simulations and analysis to improve products and processes
* Conducting structural FEM simulations such as dynamic, static, fatigue, and driveline simulations
* Collaborating with a cross-functional team of engineers and specialists to develop and implement new solutions

  


**You will need**


* A degree in engineering, physics, or a related field
* Experience in simulation and analysis, preferably within an industrial setting
* Strong teamwork and communication skills
* Solid knowledge in at least one of the following areas: dynamic, static, fatigue, or driveline simulations

  



Preferred Qualifications:


* Experience with explicit FEM
* Skills in automating simulations or developing solver user subroutines
* Knowledge outside your area of expert - mechanics, electronics, and/or software

  


**We Offer**


* An inclusive work environment where all employees can grow and develop
* A dynamic and innovative workplace that values diversity and inclusion
* Flexible working hours and the possibility of remote work
* Professional development and career opportunities within the company
* A strong focus on work-life balance

  


**Location:** Stockholm

  

**Further Information**  

For more details, please contact:



Tobias Syvertsson, Hiring Manager – tobias.syvertsson@atlascopco.com



Erik Vegelius, Simulation Engineer – erik.vegelius@atlascopco.com



Apply via our website. We look forward to receiving your application and welcoming you to our team!

  


**Uniting curious minds**  

Behind every innovative solution, there are people working together to transform the future. With careers sparked by initiative and lifelong learning, we unite curious minds, and you could be one of them.
company_description: Atlas Copco provides compressed air and gas equipment, industrial power tools, construction equipment, and industrial vacuum equipment, as well as service and maintenance. www.atlascopco.com

title: Business Development Representative (BDR)
description:
**Join Steep and help build the future of BI**
----------------------------------------------

  

Hey we’re Steep! The metrics first BI platform built for modern teams who want fast, trusted insights without the dashboard mess.


Companies like **Voi**, **Instabee,** **Stillfront**, **Veo** and others use Steep to transform how their organisation works with data, from C-level to product, finance and growth.


We’re looking for an exceptional **Business Development Representative (BDR)** to join our team in Stockholm.


You’ll play a big part in taking Steep from a fast-growing Nordic startup to a global category-defining company. You’ll join a smart, high-performing team that truly *loves* what we do. Our product is loved, and we have great momentum. But we’re just getting started, and we want you to help shape the journey.


You’ll have everything you need to succeed:


A fantastic team to work with, learn from and contribute to


A great platform for you to build your career with clear paths to more responsibility


MacBook, iPhone, and any software you’ll need


Competitive base salary + commission, based on performance


An amazing office at a top location in Stockholm


Real impact: your work directly drives pipeline, revenue and global expansion

**What you’ll do**
------------------

* Source new sales opportunities through inbound qualification and outbound outreach
* Turn intent signals (site visits, webinar/product signups, social media activity etc.) into pipeline
* Together with GTM leadership, build and execute campaigns targeting well defined ICP accounts
* Write, test and iterate messaging that cuts through the noise
* Use AI tools, automation and data to move faster and better
* Measure what matters, analyse outcomes, learn and improve
* Collaborate closely with product, marketing, and leadership. We build together
* Learn fast, succeed and step into new roles and responsibilities within 12 months

**What we’re looking for**
--------------------------

* Exceptionally driven and curious person
* Excellent English writing and speaking
* A+ communicator: email, call, video, LinkedIn. You get people to respond
* Tech-savvy and experimental mindset (you’ll build systems, automations, workflows)
* 1–3 years experience in sales, consulting, GTM, or similar
* Experience from the data/analytics industry is preferred, but not a hard requirement
* Mindset over background
* Ambition to take more responsibility and grow into other GTM roles (i.e Account Executive, GTM Engineer, BDR Team Lead, Partnerships et.c)

  

We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Embedded & Prototyping Engineer
description:
*Natural Cycles° is a leading women’s health company that developed the world’s first birth control app, used by millions globally. We are a fast growing startup, and we promote an international working environment filled with smart and ambitious colleagues based in Stockholm, Geneva, New York, and remotely. Our mission is to pioneer women’s health through research and passion, empowering every woman with the knowledge she needs to take charge of her health.*


We’re looking for an engineer who loves building things end-to-end, someone who lives in firmware but isn’t afraid to pick up a soldering iron, spin a test jig, or open Xcode to verify an app integration.


You’ll work directly with the Head of Hardware to prototype, test, and refine the next generation of wearable devices, bridging firmware, hardware, and app layers. You’ll be encouraged to generate code and move fast to explore ideas or solve problems.


If you’re motivated by curiosity and iteration, and want to work across the stack from firmware optimization to app development and data analysis, this is an opportunity to do exactly that.

**Please note that we are hiring for this role in Stockholm, Sweden.**  



  

**What you will be doing**


You’ll be hands-on across several active hardware programs, supporting:

**Firmware Development & Optimization**

  

* Implement and improve sensor drivers, data collection, and low-power algorithms
* Maintain and improve BLE communication, background updates (FOTA), and data transfer
  
* Customize and structure raw logs for testing and analytics
  
* Debug firmware plugins and integrate analytics for data validation
  
* Profile and reduce battery consumption across operating modes
  

**Hardware Prototyping & Validation**

* Perform hardware modifications and assist in sensor integration or board validation
  
* Contribute to test setups for endurance, temperature, and performance validation
  
* Support design iterations (materials, ergonomics, assembly feedback)
  
* Participate in certification and compliance efforts
  

**App & Tooling Collaboration**

* Use code generation tools to develop, extend or debug iOS and Android apps
  
* Prototype app-side visualizations
  
* Collaborate with software engineers to verify firmware to app data flows
  
* Contribute to automation and data validation pipelines when needed

 **What skills and experience we think you have**

* 3 to 5 years of experience and a strong background in embedded systems, firmware, or electrical engineering
  
* Proficiency in C/C++ and familiarity with ARM-based MCUs (e.g., nRF52, STM32, CC2642)
  
* Experience with BLE, sensor interfacing (I²C/SPI), and low-power design
  
* Comfort with hardware tools (oscilloscope, soldering, basic rework, or prototype bring-up)
  
* Interest in using AI-assisted development tools (Cursor, Copilot, etc.) for both firmware and app experiments
  
* A practical, experimental mindset you test ideas early, measure results, and iterate fast

  

**Bonus Points**

* Familiarity with data analysis and app analytics
  
* Experience with Swift (iOS), Kotlin (Android), or cross-platform frameworks like Ionic or React Native
  
* Exposure to temperature or optical sensing systems
  
* Understanding of wearable power management and BLE stack tuning
  
* Curiosity about digital health, female physiology, or biometric sensing

 **Why You’ll Love It Here**

* Work directly with Natural Cycles’ Head of Hardware on wearable development
  
* Freedom to experiment from firmware to hardware to app-level
  
* Use modern tools and do real-world R&D with a clear objectives and goals
  
* Be part of a small, deeply technical team where ideas move fast and impact is tangible
  
* 

  

**Location**


We are remote-friendly, but we find great value in connecting in person. For this role, you’ll collaborate closely with our Head of Hardware, who is based in Stockholm.


Not living in Sweden? No problem! We offer relocation support to help you move.

 **Sounds interesting?**


If you want to be part of a successful team, we encourage you to apply for this position as soon as possible. We look forward to hearing from you!

 **How to apply**


To apply, just upload your CV and answer the questions on the application form. Keep in mind that we can't accept applications through email because of GDPR, and only applications submitted via the career site (and in English) will be considered.


At Natural Cycles we value diversity and inclusion because we know that teams with people from different backgrounds and experiences are stronger. We welcome candidates from all walks of life and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.  

  

**Note****: We are not looking for consultants or help from recruitment agencies**

title: Backend Engineers - Fintech Group
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 We are looking for experienced
 **Software Engineers** 
 who can develop production-level microservices to join our
 **Fintech group** 
 here at Wolt.
   

  

 Our Engineering organization at Wolt consists of 700+ Engineers working across 70+ product teams. Some of us work on the visible parts, making our services easy on the eye and some of us focus on the unseen magic happening behind the scenes. ✨
   

  

 Our Engineers handle the whole development process (business logic, testing, database & data streaming, CI/CD, analytics, cloud) in an autonomous manner. They build things that are accessible and made to scale. They keep our systems in the best shape by simplifying the unnecessary complexity.
   

  

 We make the decisions as a team and group of teams for our ways of working and we take architectural decisions together. Everyone plays a role in our future.
   

  

 Our Engineers choose the best technologies that work for Wolt, their teams and themselves. Making good choices means finding scalable, robust technology that works in everyone’s best interests. The freedom to experiment and adopt the best technology benefits everyone.
   

  

 The main stack for these roles consists for example
 **Kotlin** 
 (Ktor, Koin, Spring, grpc…),
 **Golang** 
 (Echo),
 **PostgreSQL** 
 ,
 **MongoDB** 
 ,
 **Kafka** 
 ,
 **Redis** 
 ,
 **GitHub Actions** 
 ,
 **AWS** 
 ,
 **Docker** 
 and
 **Kubernetes** 
 .
   

  

 Needless to say, in such an environment there’s a lot of room for learning, teaching and growing together!
   

  

 Go ahead and check our Kotlin- & Golang-related Tech Talks below.
   

  

* The very fresh Scaling Kotlin Backend Development Podcast
* Kotlin at Wolt
* Kotlin Meetup
* Golang Tech Talks


 FinTech Group
   

  

 FinTech Group is dedicated to shaping the future of financial services at Wolt. 🚀 Our Fintech teams play a critical role in enabling smooth and automated money flows for our customers, merchants, and courier partners as well as delivering financial products to them. To meet local requirements and provide the best financial solutions, our Fintech engineering teams are at the forefront of building integrations and automating financial processes for local country teams, supporting expansion in our existing markets and into new ones. Our focus has been also on building Consumer Fintech, introducing brand-new products and bringing innovations that elevate the financial experience for all our users.
   

  

 We currently have multiple roles in our Fintech Teams, and depending on your experience, we will make sure to find the right team for you if you love working with modern technologies like Kotlin, are always open to learning new things, find motivation in working with skilled and nice colleagues, and don't shy away from highly challenging engineering topics, you'll fit right in! 💡👩‍💻
   

  

 📍This role can be based in one of our tech hubs in Helsinki, Stockholm, or our newest addition, Timisoara. Read more about our hybrid and remote setup here. If you live outside of these countries, don't worry! We provide relocation support to help you make your way to Finland or Sweden.
   

  

 Our humble expectations
   

  

 We'd love to see experience with
 **Kotlin or any other JVM backend languages like Java and Scala** 
 but encourage you to convince us about your learning abilities if you come from a different background. 🛠️
   

  

 As a member of our team, you'll dive into the world of
 **microservices** 
 , primarily using Kotlin, while remaining open to exploring other modern languages, such as
 **Go** 
 and
 **Python** 
 , in some teams. We appreciate previous experience in handling the whole development cycle all the way to production.
   

  

 But what truly sets you apart is your ability to tackle big challenges together, envision scalability and availability, and dare to question conventional decisions. You’ll be successful in our teams if you quickly grasp new concepts and thrive in an environment of continuous learning.🌟
   

  

 We put a lot of focus on the ability to collaborate well with others. We work closely with our teammates and having a good connection with team members is essential. We understand that everyone has their own unique way of communicating with others. We expect you to be yourself, express your opinions, and work together with the rest of the team.
   

  

 In addition to technical expertise, we cherish those who take ownership beyond the obvious, have an insatiable hunger for knowledge, make collaborative decisions, and enthusiastically collaborate with diverse teams Woltwide. We value the unique perspectives and skills you bring to our adventure, and we're excited to see what you can achieve with us! 👥 🚀
   

  

 Fluency in English language is mandatory.
   

  

 Next steps
   

  

 During the initial screening call our Talent Acquisition Partner will discuss with you your expectations and possible domain preferences as well as share more about different teams. After the recruiter screening call, the interviewing steps are conducted and a specific team being proposed at the end of the process - that’s the moment when you’ll latest get to meet your possible Team Lead. Throughout the process, we will do our best to match your experience, skills and aspirations with the most suitable team at Wolt!
   

  

 For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Severi Kausola - severi.kausola@wolt.com
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Fullstack Engineer, Fintech
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 We’re looking for a Fullstack Engineer to join our Consumer Finance Engineering team at Wolt. Our mission is to design, build, and expand consumer facing financial products that integrate seamlessly into the Wolt ecosystem and offer an enhanced experience.
   

  

 What you’ll be doing
   

  

 As an Fullstack Engineer in the Consumer Finance team, your role is to implement and contribute to the development of our beautifully designed consumer app. You will be at the forefront of Wolt’s consumer finance experience, building features that impact millions of users by enabling and creating new surfaces in our application.
   

  

 You’ll work closely with our designer, analyst, product lead, and fellow engineers as we balance our efforts to grow our advertisement business at high speed while maintaining engineering excellence. You will be involved in ensuring timely development and releases. You will also have ownership of quality assurance and solidifying our telemetry logic to ensure data accuracy and system reliability.
   

  

 We embrace a hybrid work model. Join us in our beautiful
 **Helsinki, Stockholm or Tallinn** 
**office** 
 to connect and collaborate with your teammates, or work from home whenever you choose.
   

  

**Day-to-day in this role you’ll:**
* Understand the intention of what we are building and why
* With the help of more seasoned engineers, work on assigned tasks ensuring timely delivery
* Bring new ideas to the table to discuss with the team
* Constantly learn new things and upskill
* You’ll be surrounded by experienced developers who will challenge you, mentor you, and give you the tools to accelerate your growth. If you’re ambitious, open-minded, and excited about building products that people love to use, this is the opportunity to start shaping your career.
* Your role will require an ability to handle ambiguity and rapid changes while maintaining a focus on quality and high performance. This is a unique opportunity to work on new products that will significantly impact how Merchants operate with Wolt.


 Our humble expectations
   

  

**Must haves:**
* Background in backend development, with a solid understanding of modern architectures and best practices.
* Proven experience in server side Kotlin and preferably in Go
* Web frontend experience in React
* Chart out product development plans through thorough discovery, identifying dependencies, estimations and delivery milestones
* Ability to switch between work streams based on urgency and priorities
* Solid team player who can work collaboratively with a business centric mindset
* Quality-first mindset with rock solid testing experience
* Ability to work autonomously or in team
* Help with the onboarding of new team members when needed
* Actively has participated in SRE and On-call
* Fluency in English


**Nice to haves:**
* Go beyond just writing code but also be willing to communicate and coordinate with stakeholders
* Mobile development experience in iOS or Android
* Ability to handle ancillary tasks like addressing accessibility concerns, suggesting design improvements
* Participate in the improving the ways of working of the team
* Actively investigate performance bottlenecks and suggest improvements


 We value developers who can own projects, embrace modern Frontend and Backend technologies, write testable, maintainable code, and collaborate across teams. You should be comfortable with both greenfield and legacy projects, understand the product lifecycle, and balance scalability with customer value.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

 This will be a high impact team developing consumer finance products for Wolt customers. The products have a very large user base spanning 31 countries and every decision that we make affects almost everyone. We make almost all decisions as a team and encourage all ideas and suggestions. The best part of the role is that you can physically see your products in action on the Wolt Consumer app which would be used by our customers on a daily basis.
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Senior App Developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Senior experience in app development, preferably with multiplatform frameworks (such as React Native or Kotlin Multiplatform), but also with deep knowledge of iOS and/or Android.
* Experience with authentication, app security, or digital identity is highly meritorious.
* Ability to quickly learn and adapt to new technologies and integration solutions.
* Experience working with hardware-related features (Bluetooth, NFC) and encryption is strongly desired.
* Used to working in small, autonomous teams and able to take on significant responsibility.


**Application deadline:** 
 20-11-2025
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Backend Engineer
description:
**About 0TO9:** 




  






 Team Is All
 




 Ideas matter – but people make them real. In finance, that’s harder than it should be. Innovation shapes how we live, but progress is slowed by complexity, regulations, and outdated systems. Too often, great people go elsewhere.
 



  






 0TO9 exists to change that.
 




 We’re a fintech venture builder and investor – a bank for entrepreneurship, founded in Stockholm in 2025 by serial entrepreneur Oliver Hildebrandt.
 



 Our mission: bring the right people, skills, and resources together so fintech founders can focus on building. From capital and compliance to tech and talent, we create an infrastructure for success.
 



 Numbers are the building blocks of finance and with zero to nine, we can build anything. Our name says it all: From you to a team. From idea to impact. From now to what’s next.
 



 With offices in Stockholm and Berlin, operations across the Nordics, and a growing portfolio – we’re just getting started.
 



  





**About the role** 




 At 0TO9, you won’t just build services - you’ll shape the core banking platform powering the next wave of fintech ventures. This is a chance to work with and solve complex problems at scale, and be part of building something from the ground up.
 


* Build and maintain C#/.NET Core microservices on AWS ECS for the banking platform
* Collaborate with product managers, architects, and engineers to deliver high-performance APIs
* Write clean, testable code following SOLID principles
* Apply DDD and CQRS to create modular, scalable, and maintainable systems
* Design event-driven communication using NATS
* Ensure reliability through idempotency, retries, and self-healing services
* Implement observability: logging, metrics, tracing, and performance monitoring
* Working with both relational (MS SQL Server) and NoSQL (DynamoDB) databases.
* Contribute to secure design (auth, secrets, compliance)
* Improve CI/CD, containerized workflows, and engineering practices



  





**About you** 




 We think you’ll be a great fit if you:
 


* Have backend experience working with microservices and distributed systems, C# and .NET Core and AWS
* Take ownership, challenge unclear requirements, and prioritize reliability
* Have applied DDD and CQRS in real-world systems
* Understand event-driven architectures (ideally with NATS)
* Care about writing clean, maintainable, testable code



  





*Nice to have:* 



* Previous fintech or banking industry experience
* Hands-on experience with integration testing, contract testing, or end-to-end service testing
* Knowledge of observability tools and testing strategies for microservices
* Understanding of cloud security, governance, and compliance



  





**What we offer:** 



* Be part of the leading fintech venture builder
* A dynamic, entrepreneurial, international and fast-paced environment
* Beautiful office in the heart of Stockholm
* Strong opportunities for growth and development

title: Data Engineer
description:
We’re building a specialist team to support an industry-leading global enterprise as they scale their data capabilities.
 



  





 This is a hybrid role, requiring occasional travel to the client site in Stockholm.
 



  





 We are looking for seasoned Data Engineers to join the team on a either a contract or permanent basis.
 



  





  





**The Opportunity:** 




  





 You’ll be joining a high-performing internal data team focused on solving complex challenges and shaping modern architectures that drive measurable business outcomes.
 



  





 The role sits within a major digital transformation programme, helping the organisation build a scalable, high-quality data platform using modern cloud and open-source technologies.
 



  





 You’ll design, implement, and optimise data pipelines and architectures that enable analytics, automation, and data-driven decision-making across the enterprise.
 



  





**The Experience You Need:** 




  





 To be successful in this role, you’ll bring strong engineering fundamentals and a consultative mindset. We’re looking for professionals with:
 



  




* Proven experience building real-time and batch data pipelines using tools like Apache Spark, Databricks, Snowflake, and Airflow
* Strong programming skills in Python, SQL, Scala, or Java
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP)
* Understanding of data modelling and both relational and NoSQL databases
* Experience with infrastructure and deployment tools (Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, CI/CD)
* Architectural awareness of scalable, secure, and high-performance data systems
* Ability to collaborate across multidisciplinary teams and contribute to solution design discussions
* Knowledge of governance and compliance frameworks (e.g., GDPR)



  





 Please apply immediately if this sounds like the next opportunity for you.

title: Automation Test Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

* You have 5+ years of test automation. Having experience in roles in full time test automation.

 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
